	<item>
		<title>Ride ACTA</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/rideacta/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 13 May 2015 14:03:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[nurelm]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://actapgh.org/?page_id=4</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/RideACTA-RGB.jpg"><img class="alignnone wp-image-619" src="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/RideACTA-RGB-300x158.jpg" alt="RideACTA-RGB" width="260" height="137" /></a>

Serving the Airport Corridor since 2009, RideACTA - operated by ACTA - is a shared-ride, flex-route shuttle service that transports people between the IKEA Super Stop and nearly 200 local businesses. RideACTA shuttles have seating for 25 passengers, are wheelchair accessible and offer free Wi-Fi on board the vehicles. Additionally, the shuttle can be tracked on your smartphone by downloading the RideACTA app in your respective app store.

Using the RideACTA shuttle is as easy as 1..2..3!
<ol>
 	<li>Board any of the Port Authority bus routes that serve the Super Stop at IKEA (all rides must begin or end at the Super Stop at IKEA). These routes include the 28X Airport Flyer, 29 Robinson and 24 West Park routes. When you arrive at the IKEA Super Stop board the RideACTA shuttle located behind the bus stop.</li>
 	<li>Tell the driver where you would like to be dropped off. Locations must be within 1.5 miles of the bus stop. The driver will then take you to your designated location.</li>
 	<li>When departing the RideACTA shuttle you can tell your driver what time you would like to be picked up from your location or you can call our Dispatch at 412.442.4773 to schedule your ride back to the bus stop. We do ask that riders cancel their return trip if they don't need it...no shows cause unnecessary delays for everyone.</li>
</ol>
If you would like additional information on RideACTA please contact Christy Bell at 412.533.4605.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>4</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2015-05-13 14:03:35]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2015-05-13 14:03:35]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[rideacta]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[2]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[In recent years, ACTA has more than doubled its services  without increasing its membership fees. Funding for ACTA is provided from membership dues, which are matched by PennDOT.

	<item>
		<title>About ACTA</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/about-acta/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 02 Jun 2015 19:49:18 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[nurelm]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://actapgh.org/?page_id=19</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/ACTA_021.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-499" src="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/ACTA_021-300x72.jpg" alt="ACTA_021" width="300" height="72" /></a>

The Airport Corridor Transportation Association (ACTA) is a non-profit transportation management association (TMA) located in Robinson Township in Pittsburgh's western suburbs. ACTA serves the businesscommunity located along the Parkway West from the western portal of the Fort Pitt Tunnel through Beaver County.

Incorporated in 1980, ACTA is an organization of members including private sector businesses and public agencies that collaborates to optimize use of the transportation system in the Airport Corridor by supporting and implementing programs to increase travel options, foster economic growth, reduce congestion and improve air quality.

Today, it is one of three transportation management associations in the Pittsburgh region. Members include area businesses, developers, local governments and municipalities and public entities that do business in the airport corridor.

ACTA members receive benefits from a number of services including help with transportation issues, daily traffic advisories, and quarterly membership meetings. ACTA also assists employees and job seekers find a way to work in the Airport Corridor through a number of travel options including RideACTA, carpools, vanpools, buses, bikes, and walking.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Construction</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/construction/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 02 Jun 2015 19:51:55 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[nurelm]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://actapgh.org/?page_id=23</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Roadway construction is something we all encounter in Allegheny County and beyond. Have you ever wondered what detour you should take, when a project is going to be completed or its scope of work? ACTA works with PennDOT District 11-0 to provide public outreach for several project in the county. Check out their individual pages for project specific work.

Want to know what's in store during this construction season in Allegheny County? Click <a href="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/2018-Road-Construction-Projects.docx">here</a> to see PennDOT District 11-0's 2018 roadway and bridge construction schedule.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Contact Us</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/contact-us/</link>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Have a transportation question or an issue you want to discuss with us? Need information on RideACTA? Contact us Monday - Friday from 8:30 AM - 5:00 PM.

<strong>Executive Director </strong>

<a href="mailto:lynn.manion@actapgh.org">Lynn Manion</a> 412.533.4601

<strong>Assistant Director </strong>

<a href="mailto:amy.mathieson@actapgh.org">Amy Mathieson</a>: 412.533.4602

<strong>Financial Manager </strong>

<a href="mailto:christine.miller@actapgh.org">Christine Miller</a>: 412.533.4603

<strong>Our Address</strong>

Airport Corridor Transportation Association
Robinson Plaza Two, Suite 420
Route 60 &amp; Park Manor Drive
Pittsburgh, PA 15205

	<item>
		<title>Privacy Policy</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/privacy-policy/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 03 Jun 2015 20:42:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[nurelm]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://actapgh.org/?page_id=54</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div id="sectionTitle"><strong>GENERAL</strong></div>
<div id="sectionContent">Your privacy is important to us. This privacy policy is intended to give you confidence in the privacy and security of the personal information we obtain from you while visiting our Website. However, please note that we are not responsible for any use of your personal information you provide to third-party applications or websites that may be accessed via the Products or Website. We recommend that you review the privacy policy of any third-party applications or websites that you use.</div>
<div></div>
<div></div>
<div id="sectionTitle"><strong>COLLECTION OF PERSONAL INFORMATION</strong></div>
<div id="sectionContent">When you use our Products or Website, you may be asked for personally identifiable information such as your name, address, date of birth, email address, telephone number. By giving us such information, you will need to consent to our using it in the manner described in this policy.</div>
<div>You may withdraw your consent at any time by emailing us at amy.mathieson@actapgh.org. We will return or destroy your personal information within five days of receipt of your withdrawal of consent. Cookie information, pages you have requested and your IP address may also be recorded by us and/or third parties from your browser as set out in this policy.</div>
<div></div>
<div></div>
<div><strong>USE OF PERSONAL INFORMATION</strong></div>
<div id="sectionContent">We use personal information to allow us to process your order requests and provide access to privileged areas of the Websites, . We may occasionally carry out market research and send you details of services and offers that we think may be of interest to you. If you do not wish to receive such information, please e-mail amy.mathieson@actapgh.org or, alternatively, when we send you an e-mail, it will contain a provision for you to opt out of receiving any further information from us.</div>
<div></div>
<div></div>
<div id="sectionTitle"><strong>DISCLOSURE OF PERSONAL INFORMATION</strong></div>
<div id="sectionContent">We may provide information about you to our employees and agents in order to administer any accounts, products and services provided to you by ACTA. We will not disclose your personal information to any third party unless you have consented to such disclosure or where we are required to do so by law. Should you breach our terms and conditions or terms of use or if we are under a duty to disclose or share your personal data in order to comply with any legal obligation, we may disclose your information to a relevant authority. This may include exchanging information with other companies and organizations for the purposes of fraud protection and credit risk reduction. Any disclosure of personal information will be strictly controlled and made fully in accordance with current U.S. law.</div>
<div></div>
<div></div>
<div id="sectionTitle"><strong>COOKIES</strong></div>
<div id="sectionContent">Cookies are small data files that a website you visit may save on your computer or handheld device that usually includes an anonymous unique identifier. Our Website may use cookies for user authentication, keeping track of your preferences, tracking our audience size and traffic patterns, and in certain other cases. We may include small graphic images in our email messages and newsletters to determine whether the messages were opened and the links were viewed. Third-party advertisers may also create and access cookies, which will be subject to their privacy policies  we accept no responsibility or liability for the use of such third parties cookies. If you do not wish cookies to be placed on your PC or handheld device, then they can be disabled in your web browser. The option to do so is normally found in your browsers security settings section. Please note that permanently disabling cookies in your browser may hinder your use of our Website as well as other websites and interactive services.</div>
<div></div>
<div></div>
<div id="sectionTitle"><strong>SECURITY</strong></div>
<div id="sectionContent">All security on our Websites is treated seriously. Where applicable, we undertake security steps, including use of SSL technology, on our back-end systems that store customer account information and to protect data transmissions. However, this is not a guarantee that such data transmissions cannot be accessed, altered or deleted due to firewall or other security software failures. If you have any further concerns about security, please email amy.mathieson@actapgh.org</div>
<div></div>
<div></div>
<div id="sectionTitle"><strong>POLICY CHANGES</strong></div>
<div id="sectionContent">Changes in this policy will be posted on our Website. You are advised to check our Website regularly to view our most recent privacy policy.</div>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Programs</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/programs/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 04 Jun 2015 18:07:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[nurelm]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://actapgh.org/?page_id=83</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[ACTA has committed to provide innovative programs and studies that enhance our mission to broaden the spectrum of travel options and support responsible economic growth in the Airport Corridor.

<a href="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/Untitled3.jpg"><img class=" wp-image-492 alignleft" src="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/Untitled3-170x300.jpg" alt="Untitled3" width="142" height="251" /></a>

Our recent mobility study culminated in ACTA being awarded funding to retrofit an existing overcrowded bus stop into a multi-modal super stop. The project included significant improvements for pedestrians and bicyclists including new crosswalks, a new signalized intersection with pedestrian count down signals, new bus shelters, additional seating, a bike workstation for needed repairs and an on-road bicycle lane. This program brought nearly $1,000,000 in improvements to the Airport Corridor. ACTA continues to work on bringing more transportation choices and connections to the Airport Corridor. If you would like to be a part of those discussions please contact Lynn Manion at 412.533.4601.

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<a href="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/RideACTA-RGB.jpg"><img class="alignnone wp-image-619" src="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/RideACTA-RGB-300x158.jpg" alt="RideACTA-RGB" width="202" height="106" /></a>A shared-ride shuttle that takes passengers the last mile of their commute, RideACTA has been operating since 2009. Check out our RideACTA section for more details on this valuable program.

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Membership</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/membership/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 18 Jun 2015 18:13:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[nurelm]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://actapgh.org/?page_id=180</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/ACTA_021.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-499" src="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/ACTA_021-300x72.jpg" alt="ACTA_021" width="300" height="72" /></a>

You can have a strong voice in promoting safe, inventive travel options that foster economic vitality and future growth of Pittsburghs Airport Corridor. Join ACTA now!

The Airport Corridor Transportation Association (ACTA) is a non-profit transportation management association (TMA) that promotes transportation improvements in one of Southwestern Pennsylvanias highest-growth areas. We work to improve air quality, reduce congestion, promote alternative transportation choices, increase access and mobility and bring innovative transportation solutions to Pittsburghs Airport Corridor.

Founded in 1990, our members include area businesses, local governments, educational institutions and developers who care about getting around efficiently and safely in the Airport Corridor. Additionally, for every dollar donated to ACTA, we bring back $4.00 to the Airport Corridor to invest in its sustainability and vitality.

Click <a href="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/MembershipCardsLOW.pdf">here</a> for our membership brochure and if you have any questions please contact Amy Mathieson at 412.533.4602

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Walk Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/programs/walk-pittsburgh/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 07 Jul 2015 14:30:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[nurelm]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://actapgh.org/?page_id=313</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/WalkPghColor-e1444065159538.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-477" src="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/WalkPghColor-300x65.jpg" alt="WalkPghColor" width="300" height="65" /></a>

A collaboration of the three Pittsburgh area TMAs (ACTA, OTMA and PDP TMA) and sponsored by UPMC and the University of Pittsburgh, Walk Pittsburgh is working to make Pittsburgh one of America's most walkable cities. Through its website and smart phone app the program provides resources and support to encourage walking as a viable commuting option, improve pedestrian safety, communicate the health and economic benefits of walking, and ensure that walkability is factored into transportation and development plans.

Walk Pittsburgh participants log their daily steps with our pedometer app that is free to download in either the Apple app or Google Play stores. Participants can see how their steps impact the environment and their overall well-being by checking our home page dashboard which details the number of total steps taken, the distance walked, the gallons of gasoline saved and the amount of CO2 eliminated.

You can become a part of Walk Pittsburgh by visiting <a href="http://www.walkpittsburgh.org">www.walkpittsburgh.org</a> and registering today! Please feel free to contact us at 412.533.4602 with any questions on the program.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>ACTA Bike Map</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/publications-and-resources/acta-bike-map/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 15 Jul 2015 20:02:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[nurelm]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://actapgh.org/?page_id=409</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Created in 2014, ACTA's Bike Connections is the first map created specifically for cyclists in the Airport Corridor. The map shows local bike trails - it even indicates which ones are hilly - and the roads with which the trails connect. It also shows business areas, locations of bike shops and bike racks, parking areas for trail access, and much more. The map is color-coded to identify places of interest to cyclists, from shopping and dining to parks and corporate campuses.

Interactive versions of the map are available online at <a href="http://www.actabikemap.org" target="_blank">actabikemap.org</a> and as a free smartphone app - search both Android and iPhone stores for "ACTA bike map" (at the Google Play store, be sure to include the quotes.

The paper map is available from ACTA at no charge; there's a waterproof version that can be purchased below for $5.00.
<h3>Purchase a hard copy:</h3>
[gravityform id="8" title="false" description="false"]]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>RideACTA IKEA Hours of Operation</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/rideacta/hour-of-operation/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 14 Oct 2015 16:54:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?page_id=516</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/ride-acta-logo-sm.png"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-370" src="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/ride-acta-logo-sm.png" alt="Ride ACTA Logo" width="200" height="79" /></a>

<strong>RideACTA IKEA has the following hours of operation.
</strong>

Weekdays: 6:00 AM - 12:00 AM

Saturday:7:00 AM - 11:00 PM

Sunday: No Sunday Service

Please click <a href="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/RideACTABroch4Low.pdf">here</a> for the latest RideACTA brochure which includes schedule information, etc.

	<item>
		<title>RideACTA Fare Information</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/rideacta/rideacta-fare-information/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 14 Oct 2015 17:30:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?page_id=519</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/ride-acta-logo-sm.png"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-370" src="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/ride-acta-logo-sm.png" alt="Ride ACTA Logo" width="200" height="79" /></a>

The RideACTA shuttle receives funding support from the PA Section 1513 program. PA Section 1513 requires the collection of a fare.
<ul>
 	<li>All passengers using RideACTA will be required to pay a $0.25 cash fare per trip.</li>
 	<li>Persons with disabilities will pay a $0.15 cash fare and display a Medicare ID, state-issued half-fare card or Port Authority reduced-fare card.</li>
 	<li>Children (6-11) will pay a $0.15 cash fare.</li>
 	<li>Children under 5 years ride for free when accompanied by a fare-paying customer.</li>
 	<li>Senior Citizens (65+) ride free when displaying a Medicare ID or a state-issued senior citizen transit pass.</li>
</ul>
All passengers are required to place the fare in the fare box as they enter the shuttle. Any passengers without the cash fare or the proper identification will be denied a ride.

<strong>RideACTA shuttle drivers do not carry change. Exact change must be deposited into the fare box.</strong>

Please contact Lynn Manion at 412.533.460 or Amy Mathieson at 412.533.4602 with any questions on RideACTA's fare structure.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Rider Alerts</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/rideacta/rider-alerts/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 20 Jan 2016 16:01:51 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?page_id=1068</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>RideACTA Sunday Service Alert</strong>

<strong>Sunday, January 28th was the last day of Sunday shuttle service.</strong> The service was discontinued due to low ridership and limited funding. If your employer is interested in seeing Sunday service restored and would like to contribute to the Sunday shuttle cost please contact ACTA staff at 412.533.4601 or 412.533.4602. We apologize for the inconvenience.

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>RideACTA West Busway</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/rideacta/rideacta-west-busway/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 05 Jul 2016 17:33:07 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?page_id=1814</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[RideACTA West Busway route provides service to riders who use the West Busway in Carnegie and need to get to work along Campbells Run Road in Robinson.
<ul>
 	<li>RideACTA shuttle stops at Penn Center West, Vista Park, Business Center Drive and others in this corridor.</li>
 	<li>Take the G2 West Busway All Stops from Downtown Pittsburgh. Service runs every 8-10 minutes.</li>
 	<li>Board the RideACTA West Busway shuttle at the bus shelter on Mansfield Boulevard adjacent to the Carnegie Station of the West Busway.</li>
 	<li>The RideACTA West Busway shuttle leaves the Carnegie shelter at:
<ul>
 	<li><strong>7:15 AM</strong></li>
 	<li><strong>8:00 AM</strong></li>
 	<li><strong>8:35 AM</strong></li>
</ul>
</li>
 	<li>Call Dispatch at 412.442.4773 to schedule a ride on the return trip (from your work site). RideACTA West Busway shuttle leaves Business Center Drive at:
<ul>
 	<li><strong>4:30 PM</strong></li>
 	<li><strong>5:00 PM</strong></li>
 	<li><strong>6:00 PM</strong></li>
</ul>
</li>
 	<li>Additionally, the RideACTA IKEA shuttle will be available between 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM, 1:30 PM - 3:30 PM and 7:00 PM - 10:00 PM. Riders must call dispatch at 412.442.4773 to schedule a ride. All trips go to the IKEA bus stop.</li>
</ul>
<strong>Remember</strong>
<ul>
 	<li>The shuttle will pick you up at the Carnegie Shelter at the <em><strong>times listed above</strong></em>. Do not call dispatch from the West Busway.</li>
 	<li>Be sure to be at the Carnegie Shelter at the scheduled time. The RideACTA shuttle will not wait.</li>
 	<li>The 6:35 AM RideACTA IKEA shuttle will continue to serve Campbells Run Road.</li>
 	<li>Riders must call dispatch in advance at 412.442.4773 to schedule their trip <strong><em>back</em></strong> to the Carnegie Shelter.</li>
 	<li>Be respectful of fellow passengers and shuttle drivers. Loud or disrespectful behavior will result in passenger(s) being removed from the service permanently.</li>
 	<li>No eating, drinking or phone conversations on the shuttle.</li>
</ul>
<strong>Fares</strong> (cash only, pay when you enter)
<ul>
 	<li>Adults: $0.25 per ride.</li>
 	<li>Persons with Disabilities: $0.15 with a Medicare ID, state-issued half fare card or PAT reduced-fare card.</li>
 	<li>Children 6-11 years old: $0.15</li>
 	<li>Children 5 and Under: Free when accompanied by a fare-paying customer.</li>
 	<li>Senior Citizens: Free with a Medicare ID or state-issued senior citizen transit pass.</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>PCTI Photos</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/pcti-photos/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 26 Sep 2016 14:59:27 +0000</pubDate>

	<item>
		<title>Alorica RideACTA West Busway Service</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/rideacta/egs-rideacta-west-busway-service/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 31 Oct 2016 19:13:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?page_id=2416</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>West Busway RideACTA (Alorica Only) Schedule </strong></span>

<strong><em>Effective Monday, April 9, 2018</em></strong>

The RideACTA schedule will operate as follows. All current rules and regulations remain in effect. Remember to pay 25 cash fare as you enter.

<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>West Busway service: Monday - Friday only</strong> </span>

<strong>Morning Trips</strong>

<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Leave Carnegie</span><span style="text-decoration: underline;"> Arrive Alorica
</span>

7:15 am 7:30 am

8:00 am 8:15 am

8:35 am  8:50 am

<strong>Afternoon Trips</strong>

<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Leave Alorica</span>  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Arrive Carnegie</span>

<strong>4:40 pm</strong> <strong>4:55 pm (New)</strong>

5:15 pm  5:30 pm

6:15 pm 6:30 pm

<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>IKEA Service: Monday - Friday</strong> </span>

The RideACTA IKEA 6:35 am trip will continue to serve Campbells Run Road.

RideACTA IKEA shuttle service will be available between the following hours. Riders wanting to return to the bus stop at IKEA from Alorica <strong>MUST</strong> call dispatch at 412.442.4773 to schedule a ride.
<ul>
 	<li>9:00 am - 10:30 am</li>
 	<li>1:30 pm - 3:30 pm</li>
 	<li>7:00 pm - 10:00 pm (<strong>new extended time</strong>)</li>
</ul>
<strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;">RideACTA IKEA Saturday Service</span> </strong>

The 8:35 am trip to Alorica and the 5:15 pm return trip to IKEA will continue its current operation.

8:00 PM - This is a new trip option for those working late.

<strong>Return trips to IKEA must be scheduled through dispatch at 412-442-4773</strong>

<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Rider Information</strong> </span>

The RideACTA shuttle operates from the West Busway/Carnegie Station to Campbells Run Road.
<ul>
 	<li>The Port Authority's<strong> G2 West Busway All Stops</strong> provides frequent service (every 8-10 minutes) to the Carnegie Station.</li>
 	<li>Catch the RideACTA shuttle at the bus shelter on Mansfield Boulevard adjacent to the Carnegie Station of the West Busway.</li>
</ul>
<strong>Fares </strong>
<ul>
 	<li>Cash only. Pay when you enter.</li>
 	<li>Adults: $0.25 per ride.</li>
 	<li>Persons with Disabilities: $0.15 with a Medicare ID, state-issued half-fare card or PAT reduced-fare card.</li>
 	<li>Children 5 and under: free when accompanied by a fare-paying passenger.</li>
 	<li>Senior Citizens: free with a Medicare ID or state-issued senior citizen transit pass.</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>IBEX Global Employees - Shuttle Schedule Changes</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/rideacta/ibex-employees-shuttle-schedule/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 21 Apr 2017 18:11:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?page_id=2951</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>Effective Monday, May 1, 2017</strong> the only fixed trips where IBEX Global employees do not have to call dispatch and simply wait at the designated stop in front of the building will be during the evening. Shuttle service will operate as follows:
<ul>
 	<li>Board RideACTA shuttle behind the IKEA bus stop. Let the driver know where it is you want to go.</li>
 	<li>Let the driver know what time you would like to be picked up at the end of the day or call dispatch at 412.442.4773 to schedule.</li>
 	<li>Call dispatch in advance.</li>
 	<li>Be waiting at the designated stop five minutes prior to scheduled time.</li>
 	<li>Drivers do not wait.</li>
 	<li>Due to changes in passenger pick-ups and traffic, drivers may be late but will not be early.</li>
 	<li>Pay enter - IBEX Global employees ride free when displaying employee ID.</li>
</ul>
<strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Monday - Friday only</span> </strong>

Evening Fixed Trips - Be at the stop in front of the IBEX Global building 5 minutes ahead of the times below:
<ul>
 	<li>4:45 PM</li>
 	<li>5:40 PM</li>
 	<li>6:10 PM</li>
 	<li>7:15 PM</li>
 	<li>8:15 PM</li>
 	<li>9:15 PM</li>
 	<li>10:05 PM</li>
</ul>
<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Saturday</strong> </span>
<ul>
 	<li>Call dispatch or schedule a return trip with the driver.</li>
</ul>
<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Important Information About Using the Shuttle</span>
<ul>
 	<li>Port Authority Route 28X serves the IKEA stop every 30 minutes. Routes 24 and 29 also stop near IKEA.</li>
 	<li>Shuttles wait in the IKEA lot directly behind the bus shelter.</li>
 	<li>Board the shuttle and tell the driver where you are going.</li>
 	<li style="text-align: justify;">Dispatch at 412.442.4773</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>I-279 Parkway North Improvement Project</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/construction/279-parkway-north-improvement-project/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 25 Apr 2017 18:45:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?page_id=2986</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>I-279 Parkway North Improvement Project </strong></span>

Project Start Date: Spring 2017

Project Completion: Summer 2019

<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Project Website </strong></span>

Information on the project can be found <a href="http://www.penndot.gov/RegionalOffices/district-11/ConstructionsProjectsAndRoadwork/Pages/I-279-Parkway-North-Improvement-Project.aspx">here</a>

<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Project Description </strong></span>

Work will begin in the southbound direction in 2017. The project includes concrete patching and overlay, preservation of 30 bridges and 49 overhead sign structures, repairs to 29 walls, ramp repairs, lighting improvements, HOV repairs, sign updates, guide rail and drainage improvements, and an anti-icing system installation on McKnight Road. 2018 work will occur in the northbound direction and includes a reconfiguration of the ramp from northbound I-579 to northbound I-279, lengthening of the northbound Perrysville and Madison on-ramps, and paving on Route 28 between Anderson Street and Chestnut Street. To allow 2017 work to occur, one lane of the southbound traffic will be crossed over into the northbound lanes at the Camp Horne (Exit 8) interchange. Both southbound lanes will be shifted into the HOV lanes at the Perrysville Avenue (Exit 5) interchange before re-entering mainline I-279 south of McKnight Road. Work south of Venture Street will be conducted with overnight and weekend lane closures. The project will continue through the end of June 2019.

<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>2018 Update </strong></span>

Work will occur in the northbound direction in 2018. Ramp closures, mainline I-279 lane restrictions, a traffic shift into the HOV lanes, and a single-lane of traffic crossed over into the southbound lanes are several traffic impacts that motorists will encounter in 2018. Safety improvement work, including the lengthening of Madison Avenue, Veterans Bridge and Perrysville Avenue on-ramps to northbound I-279, will be conducted this construction season. The project also includes concrete patching and overlay, preservation of 30 bridges and 49 overhead sign structures, repairs to 29 walls, ramp repairs, lighting improvements, HOV repairs, sign upgrades, guiderail and drainage improvements, and an anti-icing system installation on the McKnight Road interchange structures. The project will continue through June 2019.

<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Traffic Advisories </strong></span>

To help keep motorists informed as work progresses, PennDOT has created an email distribution list for I-279 Parkway North traffic advisories and construction updates. Enroll by sending email addresses to <a href="mailto:stcowan@pa.gov">stcowan@pa.gov</a>. Please write Subscribe  Parkway North in the subject line.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>I-376 - Airport to Business Loop 376 Reconstruction</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/construction/376-airport-business-loop-376-reconstruction/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 26 Apr 2017 14:22:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?page_id=2990</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>I-376 - Airport to Business Loop 376 Reconstruction
</strong></span>

Project Start Date: Spring 2017

Project Completion: Winter 2018

<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Project Description </strong></span>

This improvement project includes roadway reconstruction, concrete patching, sub-grade stabilizations, bridge rehabilitation work, drainage and guide rail improvements, signage upgrades, and ramp repairs. Work in 2017 will occur in the westbound direction between Business Loop 376 West (Exit 57) and approximately one mile east of the Airport (Exit 53) interchanges. Weekend-long restrictions, with one or two lane closures, will occur during the preparatory phase. Once prep work is complete, two lanes of westbound traffic will be maintained throughout the remainder of 2017, except for intermittent short-term single-lane closures during off-peak hours. Additional restrictions will occur on various ramps and on McClaren Road. Work in 2018 will occur primarily in the eastbound direction and will include a crossover. The project will conclude in mid-December 2018.

<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>2018 Update </strong></span>

Two lanes of eastbound traffic will be shifted into the westbound lanes in 2018 to continue work on this project. Improvements include roadway reconstruction, concrete patching, subgrade stabilization, bridge rehabilitation work, drainage and guiderail improvements, signage upgrades and ramp repairs. Two lanes of traffic will be maintained in the westbound direction during 2018 construction. Additionally, long-term closures of the ramps at the McClaren Road interchange and a 71-day closure of the ramp from eastbound I-376 to westbound Business Loop 376 will occur. The overall project will conclude in December 2018.

<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Traffic Advisories </strong></span>

To help keep motorists informed as work progresses, PennDOT has created an email distribution list for I-376 Parkway West traffic advisories and construction updates. Enroll by sending email addresses to <a href="mailto:stcowan@pa.gov">stcowan@pa.gov</a>. Please write Subscribe  Parkway West in the subject line.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Liberty Tunnel Phase V</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/construction/liberty-tunnel-phase-v/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 26 Apr 2017 16:00:14 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?page_id=3009</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Liberty Tunnel Phase V
</strong></span>

Project Start Date: Spring 2017

Project Completion: Spring 2019

<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Project Description </strong></span>

Work is anticipated to beging in May on the fifth phase of the Liberty Tunnel Rehabilitation project. The project includes pavement repairs, ventilation improvements including fans, motors and drives, HVAC, safety, and electrical systems upgrades, structural repairs to the fan house, and retaining wall stabilization. Restrictions include six weekend closures (three in each direction) for tunnel pavement repairs in 2017 and up to 168 northbound and 120 southbound overnight closures through February 2019. Tunnel closures will only occur one direction at a time. Weekend and nightly closures will be coordinated with the Liberty Bridge project. The overall project will end in April 2019.

<strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;">2018 Update </span></strong>

Restrictions in 2018 include 96 overnight closures of the outbound (southbound) tunnel which will be coordinated with the Liberty Bridge project. Additionally, 25 overnight closures of the inbound (northbound) tunnel will occur in late summer. Work includes pavement repairs, ventilation improvements including fans, motors and drives, HVAC, safety and electrical systems upgrades, structural repairs to the fan house and retaining wall stabilization. The overall project will end in April 2019.

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We're celebrating 25 years of providing transportation management services to the Airport Corridor! While much has changed since 1990, our core mission to support and implement programs that increase travel options, address air quality improvements and foster responsible economic growth in one of the Pittsburgh region's fastest-growing areas remains steadfast.

Click <a href="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/SmartMovesAnniversary.pdf">here</a> to view an overview of 25 years of ACTA!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>RideACTA Receives Proclamation from Allegheny County Council</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/rideacta-receives-proclamation-from-allegheny-county-council/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 25 Jan 2016 20:30:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=1079</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[On January 19, 2016 RideACTA received a proclamation from Allegheny County Council. The proclamation was sponsored by Allegheny County Council members Tom Baker, Michael Finnerty and Samuel DeMarco III was bestowed on the program for its dedication to supporting and implementing programs that increase travel options and foster responsible economic growth in Pittsburgh's Airport Corridor. Below is a link to view the proclamation in its entirety.

<a href="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/DOC015.pdf">RideACTA Proclamation</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>RideACTA Employee Fare Program</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/rideacta/rideacta-employee-fare-program/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 25 May 2017 17:01:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?page_id=3190</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[RideACTA offers employers the opportunity to pay for their employees' fares through the RideACTA Employee Fare Program. Employers who register for the program are charged on a monthly basis for their employees' rides to and from their location. Please contact Lynn Manion at 412.533.4601 or Amy Mathieson at 412.533.4602 if you are interested in participating in this program.

The following businesses are currently enrolled in the program:
<ul>
 	<li>Homewood Suites</li>
 	<li>IBEX Global</li>
 	<li>Walgreens</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 19/51 - West End Interchange to I-376 Parkway West</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/construction/route-1951-west-end-interchange-376-parkway-west/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 27 Mar 2018 17:53:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?page_id=4538</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Route 19/51 - West End Interchange to I-376 Parkway West
</strong></span>

Project Start Date: July 2018

Project Completion: December 2019

<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Project Description </strong></span>

Roadway construction will occur on approximately one mile of Route 19/51 between I-376 (Parkway West) and the West End interchange. Additional improvements include the replacement of the Shaler Street Bridge over Route 19/51 with Accelerated Bridge Construction techniques, median barrier replacement, lengthening of the Wabash Street deceleration ramp, sign structure rehabilitation and installation and ramp reconstruction work. Long-term, single-lane restrictions will be implemented.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>I-376 Parkway East: Fort Pitt Bridge to Edgewood/Swissvale</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/construction/376-parkway-east-fort-pitt-bridge-edgewoodswissvale/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 27 Mar 2018 18:27:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?page_id=4543</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>I-376 Parkway East: Fort Pitt Bridge to Edgewood/Swissvale
</strong></span>

Project Start Date: To be determined

Project Completion: To be determined

<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Project Description </strong></span>

Construction plans are being developed on this improvement project on I-376 (Parkway East) between the Fort Pitt Bridge and the Edgewood/Swissvale (Exit 77) interchange. Work includes milling and resurfacing, guiderail updates, ramp improvements, and minor bridge repairs. Project start and end dates are still be finalized; however, the work will occur in 2018.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>I-376 Parkway East: Edgewood/Swissvale to Monroeville Longitudinal Joint Repair</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/construction/376-parkway-east-edgewoodswissvale-monroeville-longitudinal-joint-repair/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 27 Mar 2018 18:34:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?page_id=4547</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>I-376 Parkway East: Edgewood/Swissvale to Monroeville Longitudinal Joint Repair
</strong></span>

Project Start Date: Summer 2018

Project Completion: December 2018

<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Project Description </strong></span>

Work will occur this summer on a project to mill and resurface the longitudinal joints on I-376 (Parkway East) in both directions between Edgewood/Swissvale and Route 22. Traffic control plans are still being developed but work may occur during off-peak hours while maintaining traffic. The overall project will be completed by the end of 2018.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>AllianceRX Walgreens Prime Employees</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/rideacta/alliancerx-walgreens-prime-employees/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 06 Apr 2018 14:21:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?page_id=4582</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Effective Monday, April 9th</strong> </span>

PM peak trips will be scheduled for Alliance RX Walgreens Prime riders convenience <strong>Monday - Friday only</strong>. <em><strong>Riders do not need to call dispatch and should simply be at either of the two designated stops 5 minutes before the scheduled time.</strong></em>

<em><strong>No other trips will serve AllianceRX Walgreens Prime between 3:55 PM - 8:30 PM Monday - Friday.</strong></em>

Times are as follows:
<ul>
 	<li><strong>4:35 PM </strong></li>
 	<li><strong>5:35 PM </strong></li>
 	<li><strong>6:05 PM </strong></li>
 	<li><strong>7:05 PM </strong></li>
 	<li><strong>8:05 PM</strong></li>
</ul>
The RideACTA shuttle service will operate on an on-call basis at all other times of the day and on Saturday. Board the shuttles at the bus stop at IKEA. Call dispatch to schedule your return trip. Please be patient and try to schedule your request in advance.

There is no shuttle service on Sunday.

<strong>Dispatch number: 412.442.4773</strong>

Pay as you enter: $.25 each trip

<strong>AllianceRX Walgreens Prime employees ride for free when displaying an employee ID.</strong>

<em>Please note: There are times when the shuttle could be 10-15 minutes late due to the high number of reservations.</em>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 3089 Flaugherty Run Road Bridge Replacement</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/construction/route-3089-flaugherty-run-road-bridge-replacement/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Apr 2018 16:47:55 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?page_id=4654</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Route 3089 Flaugherty Run Road Bridge Replacement
</strong></span>

Project Start Date: March 2018

Project Completion: Fall 2019

<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Project Description </strong></span>

Traffic will be maintained in both directions during the $4.39 million Flaugherty Run Bridge replacement project in Findlay Township. A single-lane of traffic will be maintained in each direction on one side of the bridge as crews conduct replacement work on the structure over Business Loop 376. Work will begin in March on this two-construction season project.

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>RideACTA Sees Increase in Ridership in 2018 - Smart Moves Fall 2018</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/publications-and-resources/rideacta-sees-increase-ridership-2018-smart-moves-fall-2018/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 16 Oct 2018 16:32:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?page_id=5681</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Continuing to prove its value to Pittsburgh commuters, RideACTA saw a 4% increase in ridership and added eight new stops over the past year. The shared-ride, flex-route service that transports people between the Super Stop at IKEA and nearly 250+ businesses, provided 82,000 rides during its 2017-2018 fiscal year. That equates to:
<ul>
 	<li>41,000 cars off of the road</li>
 	<li>2,788,000 vehicle miles saved</li>
 	<li>112,000 gallons of gasoline saved</li>
 	<li>27,000 tons of CO2 saved</li>
</ul>
Since its first year of service in 2009, RideACTA has provided over 615,000 rides and seen an overall increase in annual ridership of 73%. It also continues to add new locations and businesses to its list of stops. New locations added this year included Microtel Inn &amp; Suites, At Home, Drury Inn &amp; Suites, Stout Pub and Kitchen, Printscape Imaging &amp; Graphics, David's Bridal, Pool City and Dollar Tree. RideACTA now serves over 250 locations in the service area.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<title>ACTA Keeping you Informed! Fall 2018 Smart Moves</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/publications-and-resources/acta-keeping-informed-fall-2018-smart-moves/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 16 Oct 2018 19:18:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?page_id=5685</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[How many times has it happened? You get in your car and start heading to work on your normal route, only to find traffic backed up due to an accident or construction. If only you could have known ahead of time and taken a different route!

Don't leave your commute up to chance. Know <em>before</em> you go - with ACTA.

ACTA enables you to find out about any construction, road closures, or detours before you get into your car. Users get all the latest traffic advisories and construction updates immediately as they are received from PennDOT, City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County and the PA Turnpike Commission.

There are two free, no-hassle ways to sign up for ACTA Traffic alerts:
<ol>
 	<li>Register online at actapgh.org</li>
 	<li>Send your email address to amy.mathieson@actapgh.org (write "Traffic Advisories" in the subject line). ACTA does not distribute any emails addresses to third parties.</li>
</ol>
You can also receive traffic advisories on Twitter following us at @ACTAPGH. In addition, on the ACTA website (actapgh.org), you can find detailed project information for some of the larger projects happening in the Airport Corridor and throughout the region.

If you'd like to stay informed about all the great things happening at ACTA, please join us at these two exciting upcoming events:
<ul>
 	<li>Our Annual Meeting Luncheon will take place on November 27th at 11:30 AM at Chartiers Country Club. The guest speaker will be Cheryl Moon Sirianni, District Executive, PennDOT District 11-0. RSVP at actapgh.org/events or via email to amy.mathieson@actapgh.org. Cost is $40.00 for members; $45.00 for non-members.</li>
 	<li>On December 12th, ACTA along with the Engineers' Society of Western Pennsylvania and Womens Transportation Seminar Pittsburgh (WTS) are co-sponsoring an event, featuring guest speaker Jennie Granger, PennDOT's Deputy Secretary for Multimodal Transportation. The meeting will begin at 11:30 AM and take place at the Engineers' Society of Western Pennsylvania building in downtown Pittsburgh. Look for more information on this event in the near future.</li>
</ul>
&nbsp;

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>RideACTA to Launch New TransLoc App Pilot - 2018 Fall Smart Moves</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/publications-and-resources/rideacta-launch-new-transloc-app-pilot-2018-fall-smart-moves/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 25 Oct 2018 16:27:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?page_id=5727</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Last fall ACTA's RideACTA shuttle service placed second in the TransLoc MicroTransit Accelerator Challenge - a competition to identify the nation's most visionary and innovative municipal transit agencies. In January 2019, through a collaboration with TransLoc, ACTA will be launching a microtransit pilot program aimed at improving service efficiency and rider experience, shortening travel time, and reducing overall operational costs.

Through the microtransit pilot, RideACTA will be modernizing its last-mile service from the IKEA "Super Stop" in Robinson Township. In the future, ACTA hopes to add this service in Moon Township which will enable riders to access fixed-route transfer points to Pittsburgh and their place of employment. This new technology will help RideACTA drivers determine the best, most efficient route. Riders can access this technology through the RideACTA app on their smartphones. Even if riders do not have access to a smartphone, they can still make reservations online through ACTA's website or its dispatch number.

TransLoc, a technology provider of flexible, agency-owned microtransit solutions, has been a leader in the microtransit industry since 2004. Earlier this year the company was acquired by Ford Smart Mobility, which was formed in 2016 to design, build, grow and invest in emerging mobility services. Since receiving second-place honors in the challenge, ACTA has been working closely with the Durham, NC based company to bring this enhanced service to RideACTA.

Look for more information on the launch in the coming months!

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>RideACTA IKEA MicroTransit App</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/rideacta/rideacta-ikea-microtransit-app/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 13 Feb 2019 17:51:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?page_id=6082</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img class="alignnone wp-image-6076" src="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/microtransit-logo1.png" alt="" width="178" height="40" />

Your ride is now in the palm of your hand!

Introducing the MicroTransit App for RideACTA IKEA - an easier way to get your ride. RideACTA serves the Airport Corridor, allowing riders to get a shuttle directly to their place of business - and back. But now it's as simple as a few clicks on your smartphone to schedule your ride more efficiently. Download the free Microtransit app today! You can also make a reservation on your computer <a href="https://ondemand.transloc.com/">here</a>. Just create an account and select RideACTA as your agency.

<img class="wp-image-6090 alignleft" src="https://actapgh.org/wp-content/uploads/HowToBookRide-WebVersion-300x191.png" alt="" width="726" height="462" />

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Rethinking the Suburban Bus Stop</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/rethinking-the-suburban-bus-stop/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 12 Feb 2016 15:27:35 +0000</pubDate>

	<item>
		<title>RideACTA West Busway Service is Back!</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/rideacta-west-busway-service-back/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 05 Jul 2016 16:41:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=1812</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Starting July 6th, RideACTA will again provide shuttle service from the Carnegie Station of the West Busway along Campbells Run Road.
<ul>
 	<li>Stops on Campbells Run Road will include Penn Center West, Vista Park and Business Center Drive.</li>
 	<li>Take the G2 West Busway All Stops from Downtown Pittsburgh to the Carnegie Station. Service runs every 8-10 minutes.</li>
 	<li>Board the RideACTA shuttle at the bus shelter on Mansfield Boulevard adjacent to the Carnegie Station of the West Busway.</li>
 	<li>The RideACTA shuttle leaves the Carnegie shelter at:
<ul>
 	<li>7:15 AM</li>
 	<li>8:00 AM</li>
 	<li>8:35 AM</li>
</ul>
</li>
 	<li>Call Dispatch at 412.442.4773 to schedule a ride on the return trip (from your work site). RideACTA shuttle leaves Business Center Drive at:
<ul>
 	<li>10:00 AM</li>
 	<li>5:00 PM</li>
 	<li>6:00 PM</li>
 	<li>7:00 PM</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<strong>Remember</strong>
<ul>
 	<li>Riders must call dispatch in advance at 412.442.4773 to schedule their trip back to the Carnegie Shelter.</li>
 	<li>Do not call dispatch from the West Busway. The shuttle will pick you up at the Carnegie Shelter at the times listed above.</li>
 	<li>Be sure to be at the Carnegie Shelter at the scheduled time. The RideACTA shuttle will not wait.</li>
 	<li>Starting July 1, 2016 Allegheny County is planning to close parts of Campbells Run Road for construction. During this time, the shuttle will use I-79 instead of Campbells Run Road. Please be patient during construction.</li>
 	<li>Be respectful of fellow passengers and shuttle drivers. Any report of loud or disrespectful behavior will result in passenger(s) being removed from the service permanently.</li>
 	<li>No eating, drinking or phone conversations on the shuttle.</li>
 	<li>The 6:35 AM RideACTA IKEA shuttle is the only trip that will continue to serve Campbells Run Road beyond McMichael Road.</li>
</ul>
<strong>Fares</strong> (cash only, pay when you enter)
<ul>
 	<li>Adults: $0.25 per ride.</li>
 	<li>Persons with Disabilities: $0.15 with a Medicare ID, state-issued half fare card or PAT reduced-fare card.</li>
 	<li>Children 6-11 years old: $0.15</li>
 	<li>Children 5 and Under: Free when accompanied by a fare-paying customer.</li>
 	<li>Senior Citizens: Free with a Medicare ID or state-issued senior citizen transit pass.</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Attention RideACTA riders: If a disruption in the RideACTA dispatch number (412-442-4773) occurs please call the following emergency number: 412-713-4100.  The emergency number will only be operational when a disruption in dispatch service has occurred.</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/attention-rideacta-riders-disruption-rideacta-dispatch-number-412-442-4773occurs-please-call-following-emergency-number-412-713-4100-emergency-number-will-active/</link>

		<title>Attention IBEX Global RideACTA Riders!</title>

ALL employees must present their employee ID to the driver when boarding the shuttle in both directions. IF you do not have an employee ID the $.25 fare will be required.

Please have your ID ready to present to the driver as you get on the shuttle.

Your cooperation is appreciated.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Airport Corridor Transportation Association Recognized By National Leader In Transportation Technology</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/airport-corridor-transportation-association-recognized-national-leader-transportation-technology/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 18 Dec 2017 18:42:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=4194</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="gmail-p2"><b></b><i><span style="font-family: 'Verdana',sans-serif;">Local non-profit transportation management association wins Second Place in competition to find the nations most innovative municipal transit authority</span></i></p>
<p class="gmail-p5"><span style="font-family: 'Verdana',sans-serif;">In a stiff competition featuring some of the nations most enterprising municipal transit agencies, the Airport Corridor Transportation Association (ACTA) earned Second Place honors in the inaugural TransLoc MicroTransit Accelerator Challenge for its RideACTA shuttle<b> </b>service, which provides Port Authority riders with last-mile service to their place of employment.</span></p>
<p class="gmail-p6"><span class="gmail-s1"><span style="font-family: 'Verdana',sans-serif;">Were honored to receive this recognition from such a highly respected industry leader as TransLoc, said ACTAs Executive Director Lynn Manion. It shows that were making an impact and moving in the right direction as we continue to provide transportation solutions to the many jobs within the growing airport corridor.</span></span></p>
<p class="gmail-p6"><span class="gmail-s1"><span style="font-family: 'Verdana',sans-serif;">TransLoc, a Durham (NC) based technology provider of a flexible, agency-owned microtransit solutions, held the competition in order to identify the nations most visionary and innovative municipal transit agencies. Submissions from more than 15 states were judged based on four criteria: increased ridership, social and community value, environmental impact and improved efficiency.</span></span><span class="gmail-apple-converted-space"><span style="font-family: 'Verdana',sans-serif;"></span></span></p>
<p class="gmail-p6"><span class="gmail-s1"><span style="font-family: 'Verdana',sans-serif;">The two First Place winners were Detroits Office of Mobility Innovation and the Metropolitan Atlanta Rapid Transit Authority. The other Second Place winners were Lane Transit in Lane County Oregon and Pace Bus in the metropolitan Chicago area. All winners will receive access to TransLocs expertise, planning resources, data analytics, and predictive modeling in order to help stimulate demand-driven, flexible transit in the communities they serve.</span></span><span class="gmail-apple-converted-space"><span style="font-family: 'Verdana',sans-serif;"></span></span></p>
<p class="gmail-p6"><span class="gmail-s1"><span style="font-family: 'Verdana',sans-serif;">Incorporated in 1990 and located in Robinson Township in Pittsburghs western suburbs, ACTA is a non-profit transportation management association (TMA) that serves the business community along the Parkway West from the Fort Pitt Tunnel through Beaver County. The service that ACTA won Second Place for in the MicroTransit Accelerator Challenge is its RideACTA programa shared-ride, flex-route shuttle that transports commuters the last mile from the bus stop to nearly 200 employers throughout the airport corridor<b>.</b></span></span></p>
<p class="gmail-p6"><span class="gmail-s1"><span style="font-family: 'Verdana',sans-serif;">Our goal is to continue being a leader in shaping the future of mobility in this region, making sure to meet the needs of existing workers and job seekers, while focusing on reducing congestion, improving air quality, and providing travel choices, said Manion. We hope that honors such as this one from TransLoc will help us spread the word about ACTA, so that we can continue to grow and be a valuable resource to the people of Pittsburgh.</span></span><span class="gmail-apple-converted-space"><span style="font-family: 'Verdana',sans-serif;"></span></span></p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>REMINDER: Fleming Park Bridge (Neville Road) to close Monday in Neville and Stowe</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/reminder-fleming-park-bridge-neville-road-close-monday-neville-stowe/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 09 Aug 2018 15:30:51 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=5266</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The Department of Public Works announced that the Fleming Park Bridge (Neville Road) in Neville Township and Stowe Township will close at 6 a.m. on Monday, August 13, 2018. The closure, which is expected to last until the end of June 2019, is required for sidewalk replacement, steel repairs, expansion dam replacement, paint, and an overlay on the concrete deck.

Traffic will be detoured using Route 51, I-79, and Grand Avenue.

During the project, a pedestrian shuttle will be available from 5 a.m. to midnight on weekdays, 6 a.m. to 1 a.m. on Saturdays, and 7:30 a.m. to 11:30 p.m. on Sundays. Shuttles at the following designated locations will arrive at least once every 30 minutes, except for during weekends and from 11 a.m.to 3 p.m. on weekdays, when they will arrive at least once every hour.
<ul>
 	<li>Neville Road where it intersects with the industrial driveway at the northern point of the closure.</li>
 	<li>The intersection of Fifth Street and Montour Street. This is the first drop-off point where passengers can transfer from the shuttle to the Port Authority Bus Route 21 Coraopolis.</li>
 	<li>The intersection of Fourth Street and Arch Street. This is the last drop-off point where passengers can transfer from the shuttle to the Port Authority Bus Route 21 Coraopolis.</li>
</ul>
The Fleming Park Bridge, which opened in 1955, is an 804-foot through-truss structure that carries traffic over an Ohio River backchannel. The estimated $11 million project is being done by Mosites Construction of Pittsburgh, PA]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 1019 Days Run Road Bridge Replacement begins Monday in East Deer Township</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-1019-days-run-road-bridge-replacement-begins-monday-east-deer-township/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 27 Aug 2018 16:46:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=5375</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing bridge replacement work on Days Run Road Road (Route 1013) in East Deer Township, Allegheny County, will begin Monday, August 27 weather permitting.

Bridge replacement work, requiring a long-term closure, will begin at 7 a.m. Monday on Days Run Road between Creighton Hollow Road and Bailies Run Road. Crews from Joseph B. Fay Company will remove the existing structure and replace it with a box culvert structure. Additional work includes roadway and inlet repairs.

Posted Detour

North of the Closure
<ul>
 	<li>Take Days Run Road northbound</li>
 	<li>Days Run Road becomes Creighton Hollow Road/Kurn Road</li>
 	<li>Turn left onto Creighton Russellton Road</li>
 	<li>Creighton Russellton Road becomes Baileys Run Road</li>
 	<li>Follow Baileys Run Road back to Days Run Road</li>
 	<li>End detour</li>
</ul>
South of the Closure
<ul>
 	<li>Same detour in the opposite direction</li>
</ul>
The project in anticipated to conclude in late October 2018.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles by visiting <a href="http://www.511PA.com">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional Twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 2058 Verona Road Lane Restriction Underway in Penn Hills</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-2058-verona-road-lane-restriction-underway-penn-hills/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 13 Sep 2018 18:42:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=5487</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing a single-lane restriction is underway on Verona Road (Route 2058) in the Municipality of Penn Hills, Allegheny County.

A long-term single-lane restriction on the bridge carrying Verona Road over a branch of Sandy Creek between Lincoln Road and Mt. Carmel Road has been implemented due to a culvert failure. Temporary signals will control traffic through late November.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511PA.com">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 3002 Old Brodhead Road Improvements begin Monday in Center Township</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-3002-old-brodhead-road-improvements-begin-monday-center-township/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 13 Nov 2018 16:54:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=5816</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing roadway improvement work on Old Brodhead Road (Route 3002) in Center Township, Beaver County will begin Monday, November 12 weather permitting.

Single-lane alternating traffic will occur as needed on Old Brodhead Road weekdays from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. through the spring of 2019. Crews will conduct drainage work through the winter. Additional details will be provided prior to the next phase of work.

The work is part of the $11.86 million Route 18 improvement project. Lindy Paving is the prime contractor.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Southbound Route 50 Long-term Lane Restriction begins Monday in Washington, Allegheny Counties</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/southbound-route-50-long-term-lane-restriction-begins-monday-washington-allegheny-counties/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 15 Nov 2018 15:35:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=5830</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing a lane restriction on southbound Route 50 in Cecil Township, Washington County and South Fayette Township, Allegheny County will begin on Monday, November 19 weather permitting.

A long-term single-lane restriction will be implemented on southbound Route 50 at 7 a.m. Monday morning as PA Turnpike 576 pier and abutment construction work begins. The lane restriction, located between Route 978 in Allegheny County and Reissing Road in Washington County, will continue around-the-clock through late April. No restrictions will occur on northbound Route 50 at this time.

PennDOT is not involved in this work and is providing this information as a public service announcement only. For additional information, contact Pat Keith at 330-338-9841.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional Twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 351 Koppel Bridge Traffic Stoppages begin Monday in Beaver County</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-351-koppel-bridge-traffic-stoppages-begin-monday-beaver-county/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 03 Dec 2018 16:40:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=5907</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing traffic stoppages on the Koppel Bridge (Route 351) in Koppel Borough and North Sewickley Township, Beaver County, will begin Monday, December 3 weather permitting.

Traffic stoppages of 15 minutes or less will occur weekdays from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. on the Koppel Bridge through Tuesday, January 15. Crews from Brayman Construction will conduct steel erection for the new bridge from the existing structure.

Motorists should expect delays.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 168 Bridge Improvements Continue in Lawrence County</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-168-bridge-improvements-continue-lawrence-county/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 03 Dec 2018 20:54:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=5915</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing bridge improvement work continues on Route 168 in Taylor Township, Lawrence County.

Reconstruction work continues on the Route 168 structure over Route 422. A single-lane of traffic in each direction will be maintained through May of 2019 in the northbound direction of Route 168. Additionally, single-lane restrictions will occur on Route 422 at the Route 168 interchange according to the following schedule:
<ul>
 	<li>Monday through Friday  8 a.m. to 6 p.m.</li>
 	<li>Monday through Friday nights  6 p.m. to 6 a.m.</li>
 	<li>Weekend work  Saturday at 6 a.m. continuously through 6 a.m. Monday morning</li>
</ul>
Ramp restrictions may occur. Additional details will be provided prior to any ramp closures.

The work is part of a $10.32 million project to improve over four miles of Route 168 between Galilee Road near Route 18 in North Beaver Township and near Moravia Street in Taylor Township. Additional work includes bridge rehabilitation and preservation, milling, drainage and guiderail improvements, curb and sidewalk repairs, and pavement marking installation.

Additional information will be provided as work continues on this two-construction season project. Swank Construction Company, LLC is the prime contractor.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 2108 Forbes Avenue Gas Line Replacement begins Wednesday in Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-2108-forbes-avenue-gas-line-replacement-begins-wednesday-pittsburgh/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 08 Jan 2019 20:23:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=5987</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing gas line replacement work on Forbes Avenue (Route 2108) in the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, will begin Wednesday, January 9 weather permitting.

Single-lane restrictions will occur on Forbes Avenue in each direction between South Neville Street and Devon Road as crews from the M. OHerron Company conduct gas line replacement work. Restrictions will occur weekdays from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. through early April. Weekend work may occur. Traffic will be controlled by flaggers and assisted by police.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Northbound Route 19 Saw Mill Run Boulevard Long-term Lane Restriction begins Tuesday in Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/northbound-route-19-saw-mill-run-boulevard-long-term-lane-restriction-begins-tuesday-pittsburgh/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 11 Jan 2019 15:43:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=5995</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing a long-term lane restriction on northbound Route 19 (Saw Mill Run Boulevard) in the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, will begin Tuesday, January 15 weather permitting.

Beginning at 7 a.m. on Tuesday, a long-term lane restriction will be implemented on northbound Route 19 at the Shaler Street Bridge overpass. The lane restriction will remain in place through early May as crews begin utility installation for the replacement of the Shaler Street Bridge. No restrictions will occur in the southbound direction at this time.

Crews from Swank Construction Company, LLC will conduct the work.

Please use caution if traveling in this area.

Motorists can check conditions on major roadways by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional Twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>
