	<item>
		<title>Elizabeth Bridge Weekday Lane Restrictions begin Monday in Allegheny County</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/elizabeth-bridge-weekday-lane-restrictions-begin-monday-allegheny-county/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 25 Jan 2019 19:54:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6011</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing lane restrictions on the Elizabeth Bridge (Route 51) in Elizabeth and West Elizabeth boroughs, Allegheny County, will begin Monday, January 28 weather permitting.

Single-lane restrictions will occur, weather permitting, on the Elizabeth Bridge weekdays through late February as crews install bird screens. Restrictions will not occur in both directions simultaneously. Work will occur in the southbound direction from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. or in the northbound direction from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.

The work is part of the $31.3 million Elizabeth Bridge Rehabilitation Project. Additional improvements include concrete deck and barrier replacement, steel repairs, expansion dam replacement, bearing repairs, concrete substructure repairs, full painting, and drainage upgrades on the Elizabeth Bridge over the Monongahela River. Additionally, five other structures at the bridge will be rehabilitated.

Swank Construction Company LLC is the prime contractor. The overall project will end in late 2019.

To help keep motorists informed as work progresses, PennDOT has created an email distribution list for traffic advisories and construction updates for the Route 51 Elizabeth Bridge and other bridge work in Elizabeth Township. Enroll by sending email addresses to <a href="mailto:stcowan@pa.gov">stcowan@pa.gov</a>. Please write Subscribe  Elizabeth Bridge in the subject line.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 850 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Rachel Carson (Ninth Street) Bridge to Close February 11 for Rehabilitation</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/6015-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 28 Jan 2019 21:21:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6015</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The Department of Public Works announced today that the Rachel Carson (Ninth Street) Bridge in the City of Pittsburgh will close to vehicle and pedestrian traffic beginning at 6 a.m. on Monday, February 11, 2019. The closure, which is expected to last through summer 2020, is required for a $23.3 million rehabilitation project.

Traffic will be <a href="https://www.google.com/maps/dir/Fort+Duquesne+Blvd+%26+9th+St,+Pittsburgh,+PA+15222/Andy+Warhol+Bridge,+Andy+Warhol+Bridge,+Pittsburgh,+PA/Isabella+St+%26+Rachel+Carson+Bridge,+Pittsburgh,+PA+15212/@40.4464481,-80.0027145,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m20!4m19!1m5!1m1!1s0x8834f3fd6a04db29:0xb945240f3039cf09!2m2!1d-79.9989916!2d40.4451412!1m5!1m1!1s0x8834f3fdb9fb6155:0xfd44ca93d17d3125!2m2!1d-80.0014728!2d40.4463165!1m5!1m1!1s0x8834f3fc6042f085:0x16584fce5ce931c8!2m2!1d-80.0005071!2d40.448221!3e0">detoured</a> using the Andy Warhol (Seventh Street) Bridge and Isabella Street.

Major items of work during the project include:
<ul>
 	<li>New Concrete Deck</li>
 	<li>Structural Steel Repairs</li>
 	<li>Painting of the bridge Aztec Gold</li>
 	<li>Replacement of the bridge lighting with architectural lighting similar to the original</li>
 	<li>Replacement of the bridge expansion dams and drainage systems</li>
 	<li>Replacement of the sidewalks</li>
</ul>
The bridge will have a new lane configuration when it reopens. Instead of four lanes of traffic with two lanes in each direction, there will be three lanes of traffic with wider shoulders. When traveling into downtown from the North Shore, one lane will lead onto the bridge and widen out to two lanes at Fort Duquesne Boulevard. Similarly, when traveling from downtown to the North Shore, one lane will lead onto the bridge and then widen into two lanes on the other side.

The project will be completed by Brayman Construction as well as Advantage Steel and Construction, both of Saxonburg, and is being done in conjunction with PennDOT and the Federal Highway Administration.

The Rachel Carson Bridge was opened in 1926 and is one of the three Sister Bridges, the only trio of identical bridges in the world and the first self-anchored suspension bridges in the United States. This is the second rehabilitation project of the three Sister Bridges, following the Andy Warhol (Seventh Street) Bridge, which reopened in November 2017. Rehabilitation of the Roberto Clemente (Sixth Street) Bridge is expected to occur between summer 2021 and winter 2022.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 88 Library Road Shoulder Restrictions begin Monday in Bethel Park</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-88-library-road-shoulder-restrictions-begin-monday-bethel-park/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 31 Jan 2019 16:48:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6025</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing shoulder restrictions on Route 88 (Library Road) in the Municipality of Bethel Park, Allegheny County, will begin Monday, February 4 weather permitting.

Beginning Monday, shoulder restrictions will occur on Route 88 between Kings School Road and Logan Road weekdays from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. through early April as crews conduct utility relocation and drainage installation work.

The work is part of the $1.62 million Route 88 improvement project which includes widening for the installation of turning lanes at Kings School and Logan Roads. Other improvements include traffic signal upgrades, pedestrian access updates, milling and paving, and pavement marking installation.

Michael Facchiano Contracting, Inc. is the prime contractor.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 837 East Carson Street Lane Closures begin Monday Night in Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-837-east-carson-street-lane-closures-begin-monday-night-pittsburgh/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 07 Feb 2019 19:46:18 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6047</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing manhole repair work on East Carson Street (Route 837) in the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, will begin Monday night, February 11 weather permitting.

Single-lane closures will occur as needed on East Carson Street between Smithfield Street and South 25th Street from 7 p.m. to 6 a.m. weeknights through Friday night, March 8. Crews from the Duquesne Light Company will conduct manhole repairs.

PennDOT is not involved in this work and is providing this information as a public service announcement only. For additional information contact Traci Jackson at 412-393-7813.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 1013 Saxonburg Boulevard Sanitary Sewer Work begins Monday in OHara Township</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-1013-saxonburg-boulevard-sanitary-sewer-work-begins-monday-ohara-township/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 08 Feb 2019 15:50:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6053</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing sanitary sewer work on Saxonburg Boulevard (Route 1013) in OHara Township, Allegheny County, will begin Monday, February 11 weather permitting.

Single-lane restrictions will occur from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. weekdays at the intersection of Saxonburg Boulevard and Brownshill Road through Friday, February 22. Crews from Chivers Construction Company, Inc. will conduct sanitary sewer installation work. Flaggers will assist motorists through the work zone.

PennDOT is not involved in this work and is providing this information as a public service announcement only. For additional information contact Rick Weschler at 814-474-2637 ext. 136.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>I-376 Vanport Bridge Weekday Lane Restrictions begin Monday in Beaver County</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/376-vanport-bridge-weekday-lane-restrictions-begin-monday-beaver-county/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 08 Feb 2019 19:03:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6055</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing lane restrictions on the Vanport Bridge (I-376 Beaver Valley Expressway) in Vanport and Potter townships, Beaver County, will begin Monday, February 11 weather permitting.

Single-lane restrictions will occur on the Vanport Bridge weekdays through late mid-March as crews install bird screens. Work will occur in the westbound direction from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. and in the eastbound direction from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>REMINDER: Rachel Carson (Ninth Street) Bridge to Close Monday for Rehabilitation</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/reminder-rachel-carson-ninth-street-bridge-close-monday-rehabilitation/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 08 Feb 2019 19:07:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6057</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The Department of Public Works announced today that the Rachel Carson (Ninth Street) Bridge in the City of Pittsburgh will close to vehicle and pedestrian traffic beginning at 6 a.m. on Monday, February 11, 2019. The closure, which is expected to last through summer 2020, is required for a $23.3 million rehabilitation project.

Traffic will be <a href="https://www.google.com/maps/dir/Fort+Duquesne+Blvd+%26+9th+St,+Pittsburgh,+PA+15222/Andy+Warhol+Bridge,+Andy+Warhol+Bridge,+Pittsburgh,+PA/Isabella+St+%26+Rachel+Carson+Bridge,+Pittsburgh,+PA+15212/@40.4464481,-80.0027145,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m20!4m19!1m5!1m1!1s0x8834f3fd6a04db29:0xb945240f3039cf09!2m2!1d-79.9989916!2d40.4451412!1m5!1m1!1s0x8834f3fdb9fb6155:0xfd44ca93d17d3125!2m2!1d-80.0014728!2d40.4463165!1m5!1m1!1s0x8834f3fc6042f085:0x16584fce5ce931c8!2m2!1d-80.0005071!2d40.448221!3e0">detoured</a> using the Andy Warhol (Seventh Street) Bridge and Isabella Street.

The Three Rivers Heritage Trail will remain open near the bridge  on the North Shore and Downtown  for the duration of the project.

Major items of work during the project include:
<ul>
 	<li>New Concrete Deck</li>
 	<li>Structural Steel Repairs</li>
 	<li>Painting of the bridge Aztec Gold</li>
 	<li>Replacement of the bridge lighting with architectural lighting similar to the original</li>
 	<li>Replacement of the bridge expansion dams and drainage systems</li>
 	<li>Replacement of the sidewalks</li>
</ul>
The bridge will have a new lane configuration when it reopens. Instead of four lanes of traffic with two lanes in each direction, there will be three lanes of traffic with wider shoulders. When traveling into downtown from the North Shore, one lane will lead onto the bridge and widen out to two lanes at Fort Duquesne Boulevard. Similarly, when traveling from downtown to the North Shore, one lane will lead onto the bridge and then widen into two lanes on the other side.

The project will be completed by Brayman Construction as well as Advantage Steel and Construction, both of Saxonburg, and is being done in conjunction with PennDOT and the Federal Highway Administration.

The Rachel Carson Bridge was opened in 1926 and is one of the three Sister Bridges, the only trio of identical bridges in the world and the first self-anchored suspension bridges in the United States. This is the second rehabilitation project of the three Sister Bridges, following the Andy Warhol (Seventh Street) Bridge, which reopened in November 2017. Rehabilitation of the Roberto Clemente (Sixth Street) Bridge is expected to occur between summer 2021 and winter 2022.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Southbound I-279 Overnight Sign Improvement Work Continues Monday in Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/southbound-279-overnight-sign-improvement-work-continues-monday-pittsburgh/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 08 Feb 2019 21:05:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6059</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing overnight sign improvement work on southbound I-279 (Parkway North) in the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, will continue Monday night, February 11 weather permitting.

Overnight sign improvement work will occur from 7 p.m. to 6 a.m. weeknights through Friday night, February 22 in the following locations:
<ul>
 	<li>Traffic stoppages of 15 minutes or less as needed on southbound I-279 between the East Street (Exit 4) off-ramp and the East Ohio Street underpass</li>
 	<li>Single-lane restriction on southbound I-279 between the East Ohio Street underpass and the North Shore (Exit 1B) off-ramp</li>
</ul>
Crews from the Trumbull Corporation will conduct the work.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>I-279 Parkway North Shoulder Improvement Work Underway in Allegheny County  </title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/279-parkway-north-shoulder-improvement-work-underway-allegheny-county-%e2%80%8b/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 12 Feb 2019 20:20:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6069</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing shoulder improvement work is underway on the Parkway North (I-279) in Ohio and Ross townships and the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County.

Single-lane and shoulder restrictions will occur as needed in various locations on the Parkway North between the Perrysville Avenue (Exit 5) and just north of the Camp Horne Road (Exit 8) interchanges through late March. Additionally, restrictions will occur at the Camp Horne Road, Bellevue/West View, and Perrysville Avenue ramps. Restrictions will occur as crews construct shoulder improvement work according to the following schedule:

Northbound (outbound)
<ul>
 	<li>Shoulder restrictions from 8 a.m. to 2 p.m. on weekdays</li>
</ul>
Southbound (inbound)
<ul>
 	<li>Right shoulder restrictions from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. on weekdays</li>
</ul>
The $87.94 million I-279 Parkway North Improvement Project includes concrete patching and overlay, preservation of 30 bridges and 49 overhead sign structures, repairs to 29 walls, ramp repairs, lighting improvements, HOV repairs, sign upgrades, guide rail and drainage improvements, and an anti-icing system installation on bridges at the McKnight Road interchange.

Crews from the Trumbull Corporation and Lindy Paving will conduct the work. Please use caution while driving through the area. Work zone safety is everyones responsibility.

To help keep motorists informed as work progresses, PennDOT has created an email distribution list for I-279 Parkway North traffic advisories and construction updates. Enroll by sending email addresses to <a href="mailto:stcowan@pa.gov">stcowan@pa.gov</a>. Please write Subscribe  Parkway North in the subject line.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Prospect Road in Baldwin Borough Partially Reopens to Traffic</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/prospect-road-baldwin-borough-partially-reopens-traffic/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 15 Feb 2019 13:55:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6104</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The Department of Public Works announced that one of Prospect Roads two lanes between Beryl Drive and Streets Run Road in Baldwin Borough has reopened to traffic. The road had been closed since Tuesday, February 12, 2019 because of a landslide.

Alternating traffic will be controlled with a signal where the road becomes a single lane.

There remains no timetable for when the landslide area will be repaired and the closed lane reopened.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>6104</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2019-02-15 09:55:36]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2019-02-15 13:55:36]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>

	<item>
		<title>Route 2001 Bunola River Road Closed in Forward Township</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-2001-bunola-river-road-closed-forward-township/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 15 Feb 2019 13:56:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6106</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing a portion of Bunola River Road (Route 2001) in Forward Township, Allegheny County, has closed to traffic due to a slide.

Bunola River Road is closed in both directions between River Hill Road and Elkhorn Road due to a landslide. All traffic will be detoured.

Posted Detour

North of the slide
<ul>
 	<li>Take Raccoon Run Road (Route 2005)</li>
 	<li>Turn right onto River Hill Road (Route 2007)</li>
 	<li>Follow River Hill Road (Route 2007) to Bunola River Road</li>
 	<li>End detour</li>
</ul>
South of the slide
<ul>
 	<li>Same detour in the opposite direction</li>
</ul>
Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional Twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 4021 Camp Horne Road Lane Restriction Continues Next Week in Ohio Township</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-4021-camp-horne-road-lane-restriction-continues-next-week-ohio-township/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 15 Feb 2019 13:57:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6112</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing a lane restriction on Camp Horne Road (Route 4021) in Ohio Township, Allegheny County, will continue Monday through Thursday, February 18-21 weather permitting.

A single-lane restriction will occur as needed in the eastbound direction on Camp Horne Road between Ben Avon Heights Road and the on-ramp to southbound I-279 from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. each day. Crews from Bronder Technical Services will conduct utility work.

The work is part of the $87.94 million I-279 Parkway North Improvement Project which includes concrete patching and overlay, preservation of 30 bridges and 49 overhead sign structures, repairs to 29 walls, ramp repairs, lighting improvements, HOV repairs, sign upgrades, guide rail and drainage improvements, and an anti-icing system installation on bridges at the McKnight Road interchange.

Please use caution while driving through the area. Work zone safety is everyones responsibility.

To help keep motorists informed as work progresses, PennDOT has created an email distribution list for I-279 Parkway North traffic advisories and construction updates. Enroll by sending email addresses to <a href="mailto:stcowan@pa.gov">stcowan@pa.gov</a>. Please write Subscribe  Parkway North in the subject line.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional Twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Route 18 Water Line Installation Work begins Monday in Beaver Falls</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-18-water-line-installation-work-begins-monday-beaver-falls/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 15 Feb 2019 19:22:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6117</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing water line installation work on Route 18 (7th Avenue) in the City of Beaver Falls, Beaver County, will begin Monday, February 18 weather permitting.

A single-lane restriction will occur on northbound Route 18 between 14th Street and 15th Street weekdays from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. through Friday, March 1. Crews from the Beaver Falls Municipal Authority will conduct water line installation work.

PennDOT is not involved in this work and is providing this information as a public service announcement only. For additional information contact Sam Aloi at 724-624-4212.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 2080 Hunter Road Slide Remediation Work begins Tuesday in Penn Hills</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-2080-hunter-road-slide-remediation-work-begins-tuesday-penn-hills__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 21 Nov 2018 18:43:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=5863</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing slide repair work on Route 2080 (Hunter Road) in the Municipality of Penn Hills, Allegheny County will begin Tuesday, November 27 weather permitting.

Slide remediation work, drainage improvements, roadway reconstruction, and guiderail installation will begin at 7 a.m. Tuesday morning. To allow the work to occur the roadway will close to thru-traffic between Barger Street and Hamil Road through late January. Traffic will be detoured.

Posted Detour

West of the Slide
<ul>
 	<li>Follow Hunter Road westbound</li>
 	<li>Hunter Road becomes Plum Street</li>
 	<li>Turn left onto Allegheny River Boulevard (Route 2073)</li>
 	<li>Turn left onto Sandy Creek Road (Route 130)</li>
 	<li>Turn left onto Verona Road (Route 2058)</li>
 	<li>Verona Road becomes Saltsburg Road</li>
 	<li>Turn left onto Hulton Road (Route 2074)</li>
 	<li>Turn left onto Hamil Road</li>
 	<li>Follow Hamil Road back to Hunter Road</li>
 	<li>End detour</li>
</ul>
East of the Slide
<ul>
 	<li>Same detour in the opposite direction</li>
</ul>
Crews from A. Liberoni, Inc. will conduct the work.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Green Tree Road Signal Improvements begin Monday in Green Tree Borough</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/green-tree-road-signal-improvements-begin-monday-green-tree-borough__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 11 Jan 2019 16:43:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=5998</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing traffic signal improvement work on Green Tree Road (Routes 121/3101) in Green Tree Borough, Allegheny County, will begin Monday, January 14 weather permitting.

Single-lane restrictions will occur from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. weekdays through Monday, February 18 on Green Tree Road between McKinney Lane and Potomac Avenue. Crews from Bronder Technical Services will conduct traffic signal updates at seven intersections. At least one lane in each direction will remain open while the work occurs. Off-duty police will assist motorists as needed.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Overnight Sign Improvement Work begins Monday in Allegheny County</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/overnight-sign-improvement-work-begins-monday-allegheny-county__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 11 Jan 2019 19:55:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6000</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing overnight signage improvement work in various locations in the City of Pittsburgh and Ross Township, Allegheny County, will begin Monday night, January 14 weather permitting.

Overnight signage improvement work requiring lane restrictions will occur from 7 p.m. to 6 a.m. weeknights through Thursday night, January 24 in the following locations:
<ul>
 	<li>Northbound I-279 between the East Street Bridge and Gerst Way Pedestrian Bridge in Pittsburgh</li>
 	<li>Northbound I-279 between the Sufflok Street Bridge and the Hazlett Street (Exit 3) interchange in Pittsburgh</li>
 	<li>Northbound I-279 between the Milroy Street Bridge and the McKnight Road/Evergreen Road (Exit 4) interchange in Pittsburgh</li>
 	<li>Northbound I-579 from the East Ohio Street Bridge to the Tripoli Street Bridge in Pittsburgh</li>
 	<li>Southbound I-279 between the Jacks Run Bridge in Ross Township to the East Ohio Street Bridge in Pittsburgh</li>
 	<li>McKnight Road/Evergreen Road (Exit 4) off-ramp between northbound I-279 and the ramp split at McKnight Road and Evergreen Road in Pittsburgh</li>
</ul>
Crews from the Trumbull Corporation will conduct the work.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 48 Mosside Boulevard Bridge Inspection Saturday in Monroeville</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-48-mosside-boulevard-bridge-inspection-saturday-monroeville__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 25 Jan 2019 19:54:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6009</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing bridge inspection activities on Route 48 (Mosside Boulevard) in the Municipality of Monroeville, Allegheny County, will occur Saturday, January 26 weather permitting.

A single-lane restriction will occur in each direction on Route 48 on the bridge located over Turtle Creek between Wall Avenue and Route 130. Inspection activities will occur from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. Saturday.

Crews from Mackin Engineering Company and the Sofis Rigging Company will conduct the inspection work.

Motorists should be prepared for changing traffic patterns. Please use caution when driving through the area. Work zone safety is everyones responsibility.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional Twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 885 Boulevard of the Allies Bridge Inspections Saturday and Sunday in Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-885-boulevard-allies-bridge-inspections-saturday-sunday-pittsburgh__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 25 Jan 2019 20:06:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6013</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing bridge inspection activities on the Boulevard of the Allies (Route 885) in the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, will occur on Saturday and Sunday, January 26-27 weather permitting.

Single-lane and shoulder restrictions will occur on the Boulevard of the Allies, eastbound I-376 (Parkway East) and associated ramps from 7 a.m. to noon each day.

Crews from JMT, WSP and the Sofis Rigging Company will conduct the inspection work.

Motorists should be prepared for changing traffic patterns. Please use caution when driving through the area. Work zone safety is everyones responsibility.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional Twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Overhead Sign Inspections Tuesday and Wednesday in Allegheny County</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/overhead-sign-inspections-tuesday-wednesday-allegheny-county__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 28 Jan 2019 21:24:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6018</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing overhead sign inspection activities on various bridges in Allegheny County, will occur Tuesday and Wednesday, January 29-30 weather permitting.

Lane restrictions will occur 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. each day in the following locations:

Tuesday, January 29
<ul>
 	<li>62nd Street Bridge (Route 8) in each direction between Butler Street and Route 28</li>
 	<li>Tarentum Bridge (Route 366) in the southbound direction at the Route 1001 (Freeport Road/7th Avenue) intersection</li>
</ul>
Wednesday, January 30
<ul>
 	<li>Highland Park Bridge (Route 1005) in each direction between Washington Avenue and Route 28</li>
</ul>
Crews from Mackin Engineering Company and the Sofis Rigging Company will conduct the inspections.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>10th Street Bypass to Fort Duquesne Bridge Ramp Inspection Work Thursday and Friday in Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/10th-street-bypass-fort-duquesne-bridge-ramp-inspection-work-thursday-friday-pittsburgh__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 29 Jan 2019 18:57:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6021</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing inspection activities on the 10th Street Bypass ramp to the Fort Duquesne Bridge in the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, will occur Thursday and Friday, January 31-February 1 weather permitting.

A partial lane restriction will occur on the ramp that carries traffic from the 10th Street Bypass to the Fort Duquesne Bridge from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. each day. Crews from Mackin Engineering Company and the Sofis Rigging Company will conduct inspection activities. All ramps will remain open.

Motorists should be prepared for changing traffic patterns. Please use caution when driving through the area. Work zone safety is everyones responsibility.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 30 Lincoln Highway Drilling begins Thursday in Beaver County</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-30-lincoln-highway-drilling-begins-thursday-beaver-county__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 31 Jan 2019 16:48:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6023</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing lane restrictions on Route 30 (Lincoln Highway) in Greene Township, Beaver County, will begin Thursday, January 31 weather permitting.

Single-lane alternating traffic will occur on Route 30 between Verobed Road and Reddog Road weekdays from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. through Friday, February 8. Crews will excavate utility test holes.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Northbound I-279 Parkway North Lane Restriction Next Week in Allegheny County</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/northbound-279-parkway-north-lane-restriction-next-week-allegheny-county__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 31 Jan 2019 16:49:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6027</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing lane restrictions on northbound I-279 (Parkway North) in the City of Pittsburgh and Ross and Ohio townships, Allegheny County will occur Monday through Friday, February 4-8 weather permitting.

A single-lane restriction will occur on northbound I-279 from 8 a.m. to 2 p.m. each day in the following locations:
<ul>
 	<li>Between the Madison Avenue on-ramp to the Hazlett Street (Exit 3) interchange</li>
 	<li>Between the Perrysville Avenue (Exit 5) to the Camp Horne Road (Exit 8) interchanges</li>
</ul>
Crews will conduct underground pipe inspection and mulch blanket installation.

Please use caution while driving through the area. Work zone safety is everyones responsibility.

To help keep motorists informed as work progresses, PennDOT has created an email distribution list for I-279 Parkway North traffic advisories and construction updates. Enroll by sending email addresses to <a href="mailto:stcowan@pa.gov">stcowan@pa.gov</a>. Please write Subscribe  Parkway North in the subject line.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Fort Duquesne Bridge to 10th Street Bypass Ramp Inspection Saturday in Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/fort-duquesne-bridge-10th-street-bypass-ramp-inspection-saturday-pittsburgh__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 01 Feb 2019 19:40:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6029</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing inspection activities on the Fort Duquesne Bridge ramp to the 10th Street Bypass in the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, will occur Saturday, February 2 weather permitting.

A single-lane restriction will occur on the ramp that carries traffic from the Fort Duquesne Bridge (southbound I-279 lower deck) to the 10th Street Bypass from 6 a.m. to noon on Saturday. Additionally, a partial lane closure will occur on the 10th Street Bypass ramp to the Fort Duquesne Bridge to allow the work to occur.

Crews from Mackin Engineering Company and the Sofis Rigging Company will conduct inspection activities. All ramps will remain open.

Motorists should be prepared for changing traffic patterns. Please use caution when driving through the area. Work zone safety is everyones responsibility.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Fort Duquesne Bridge to Reedsdale Street Ramp Inspection Next Week in Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/fort-duquesne-bridge-reedsdale-street-ramp-inspection-next-week-pittsburgh__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 01 Feb 2019 20:48:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6031</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing inspection activities on the Fort Duquesne Bridge ramp to Reedsdale Street in the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, will occur Monday through Friday, February 4-8 weather permitting.

Single-lane restriction will occur from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. each day in the following locations:
<ul>
 	<li>Fort Duquesne Bridge (upper deck)</li>
 	<li>Ramp from the Fort Duquesne Bridge to Reedsdale Street</li>
 	<li>Southbound Route 65 approaching the Fort Duquesne Bridge (low deck)</li>
</ul>
Crews from Mackin Engineering Company and the Sofis Rigging Company will conduct inspection activities. All ramps will remain open.

Motorists should be prepared for changing traffic patterns. Please use caution when driving through the area. Work zone safety is everyones responsibility.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Outbound Fort Pitt Tunnel Maintenance Monday Night in Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/outbound-fort-pitt-tunnel-maintenance-monday-night-pittsburgh__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 04 Feb 2019 18:08:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6033</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing maintenance activities in the outbound (westbound) Fort Pitt Tunnel in the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, will occur Monday night, February 4.

A single-lane restriction will occur in the outbound Fort Pitt Tunnel from 10 p.m. Monday night to 5 a.m. Tuesday morning as crews conduct standpipe maintenance operations.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>I-376 Parkway East Overnight Lane Restrictions Next Week in Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/376-parkway-east-overnight-lane-restrictions-next-week-pittsburgh__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 04 Feb 2019 18:08:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6035</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing overnight lane restrictions on I-376 (Parkway East) in the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, will occur Monday through Thursday nights, February 4-7 weather permitting.

I-376 will be reduced to a single-lane in each direction in various locations between the Fort Pitt Bridge and the Squirrel Hill Tunnel. Crews will conduct guiderail work, strip seal installation, and drainage repairs. Restrictions will occur from 9 p.m. to 5 a.m. each night.

Motorists should use caution when traveling through the area.

To help keep motorists informed as work progresses, PennDOT has created an email distribution list for I-376 Parkway East traffic advisories and construction updates. Enroll by sending email addresses to <a href="mailto:stcowan@pa.gov">stcowan@pa.gov</a>. Please write Subscribe  Parkway East in the subject line.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional Twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Overnight Sign Improvement Work begins Tonight in Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/overnight-sign-improvement-work-begins-tonight-pittsburgh__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 04 Feb 2019 19:42:12 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6038</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing overnight sign improvement work in various locations in the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, will begin tonight, Monday night, February 4 weather permitting.

Overnight sign improvement work will occur from 7 p.m. to 6 a.m. weeknights through Friday night, February 15 in the following locations:
<ul>
 	<li>Single-lane and shoulder restrictions on northbound I-279 between the Fort Duquesne Bridge and the Chestnut Street/East Ohio Street/Etna (Exit 1D) off-ramp;</li>
 	<li>Single-lane restrictions on northbound I-579 between the East Ohio Street Bridge overpass to the merge point with northbound I-279;</li>
 	<li>Lane shift on the Fort Duquesne Bridge ramp from the Route 65 split to the northbound I-279 merge point;</li>
 	<li>Shoulder restriction on northbound Route 28 from Anderson Street to the Chestnut Street Bridge;</li>
 	<li>Shoulder restriction on southbound I-279 between the North Shore (Exit 1B) and the North 65/Ohio River Boulevard (Exit 1C) interchanges; and</li>
 	<li>Two-lane closure on the Fort Duquesne Bridge (upper deck) beginning at the Fort Duquesne Boulevard on-ramp. This work will occur Monday through Wednesday nights, February 4-6. The Pennsylvania State Police will assist with traffic control.</li>
</ul>
Crews from the Trumbull Corporation will conduct the work.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 1005 Chapel Drive Water Line Relocation Work begins Tuesday in North Sewickley</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-1005-chapel-drive-water-line-relocation-work-begins-tuesday-north-sewickley/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 15 Feb 2019 19:22:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6119</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing water line relocation work on Chapel Drive (Route 1005) in North Sewickley, Beaver County, will begin Tuesday, February 19 weather permitting.

Single-lane alternating traffic will occur in each direction of Chapel Drive between Fairview Drive and Mercer Road weekdays from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. through Friday, March 15. Crews from the Allison Park Contractors will conduct the water line relocation work.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Route 910 Wexford Road Emergency Repair Begins Tuesday in Pine Township</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-910-wexford-road-emergency-repair-begins-tuesday-pine-township/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 15 Feb 2019 20:37:03 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6121</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing repair work on Route 910 (Wexford Road) in the Pine Township, Allegheny County, will begin Tuesday, February 19.

A lane restriction will occur on Wexford Road in the northbound direction between North Chapel Drive and Village Club Drive beginning 7 a.m. Tuesday around-the-clock through 5 p.m. Tuesday, March 5. Traffic may be shifted to the left turning lane as needed.

Crews from Allison Park Contractors will perform emergency repairs to cross pipes under the roadway.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

	<item>
		<title>Highland Park Interchange Inspection Activities continue Friday in Allegheny County</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/highland-park-interchange-inspection-activities-continue-friday-allegheny-county/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 21 Feb 2019 20:37:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6123</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing inspection work at the Highland Park interchange in OHara Township and Sharpsburg and Aspinwall boroughs, Allegheny County, will continue Friday, February 22 weather permitting.

Inspection work will occur from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. according to the following schedule:

Friday, February 22
<ul>
 	<li>Single-lane restriction on the Highland Park Bridge in the northbound direction near the Freeport Road on-ramp</li>
 	<li>Single-lane restriction on the Highland Park Bridge in the northbound direction over Freeport Road</li>
 	<li>Lane restriction on 6th Street in Aspinwall</li>
</ul>
Additional work will continue next week, Monday, February 25 through Friday, March 1. Details will be provided prior to work beginning.

Crews from Michael Baker International, The Markosky Engineering Group, Inc. and the Pittsburgh Rigging Company will conduct inspection activities.

Motorists can check conditions on major roadways by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional Twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Route 168 Shoulder Repair Work Friday in Taylor Township</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-168-shoulder-repair-work-friday-taylor-township/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 22 Feb 2019 13:49:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing shoulder repair work on Route 168 in Taylor Township, Lawrence County, will occur Friday, February 22 weather permitting.

Shoulder repair work will occur from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Friday on Route 168 between the Route 422 interchange and Cherry Street. Short-term shoulder restrictions will occur.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 3035 Stewart Avenue Lane Restriction Friday in Whitehall and Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-3035-stewart-avenue-lane-restriction-friday-whitehall-pittsburgh/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 22 Feb 2019 14:19:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6127</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT is announcing lane restrictions on Route 3035 (Stewart Avenue) in the City of Pittsburgh and Whitehall Borough, Allegheny County, will occur Friday, February 22 weather permitting.

A single-lane restriction will occur on Stewart Avenue between Provost Road and Route 51 from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Friday. Crews from Allison Park Contractors will set a mast arm.

Motorists should be prepared for changing traffic patterns. Please slow down and drive safely through the work zone. Work zone safety is everyones responsibility.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>17th Annual ACTA Spring Construction Update Meeting</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/event/17th-annual-acta-spring-construction-update-meeting/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 07 Mar 2016 17:41:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?post_type=tribe_events&#038;p=1198</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Join us on April 12th as PennDOT District 11-0 and the Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission discuss projects planned for the 2018 construction season in Allegheny and Beaver counties.

Additionally, county and municipal representatives will be present to provide information on their projects impacting the Airport Corridor.

<u>Guest Speaker </u>

Todd Kravits, P.E.

District Traffic Engineer

PennDOT District 11-0

[gravityform id="10" title="true" description="true"]

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Inbound Squirrel Hill Tunnel Lane Restriction Wednesday Night in Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/inbound-squirrel-hill-tunnel-lane-restriction-wednesday-night-pittsburgh__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 06 Feb 2019 14:32:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6041</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT is announcing a lane restriction in the inbound (westbound) Squirrel Hill Tunnel (I-376 Parkway East) in the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, will occur Wednesday night, February 6.

A single-lane restriction will occur in the inbound direction of the tunnel from 10 p.m. Wednesday night to 5 a.m. Thursday morning as crews conduct hardware installation work.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>6041</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2019-02-06 10:32:02]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2019-02-06 14:32:02]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[inbound-squirrel-hill-tunnel-lane-restriction-wednesday-night-pittsburgh__trashed]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[trash]]></wp:status>

	<item>
		<title>I-376 Shoulder Restriction Wednesday and Thursday in Moon Township</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/376-shoulder-restriction-wednesday-thursday-moon-township__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 06 Feb 2019 15:46:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6043</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing shoulder restrictions on Interstate 376 in Moon Township, Allegheny County, will occur Wednesday and Thursday, February 6-7 weather permitting.

Shoulder restrictions will occur in various locations in each direction on I-376 between the McClaren Road (Exit 56) interchange and Toll Road 576 from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. each day. Crews will be cleaning inlets.

To help keep motorists informed as work progresses, PennDOT has created an email distribution list for I-376 Parkway West traffic advisories and construction updates. Enroll by sending email addresses to <a href="mailto:stcowan@pa.gov">stcowan@pa.gov</a>. Please write Subscribe  Parkway West in the subject line.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional Twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>10th Street Bypass Ramp Fort Duquesne Bridge Inspection Work Saturday in Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/10th-street-bypass-ramp-fort-duquesne-bridge-inspection-work-saturday-pittsburgh__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 07 Feb 2019 19:20:03 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6045</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing inspection activities on the 10th Street Bypass ramp to the Fort Duquesne Bridge in the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, will continue Saturday, February 9 weather permitting.

A partial lane restriction will occur on the ramp that carries traffic from the 10th Street Bypass to the Fort Duquesne Bridge from 7 a.m. to 2 p.m. Saturday. Crews from Mackin Engineering Company and the Sofis Rigging Company will conduct inspection activities. All ramps will remain open.

Motorists should be prepared for changing traffic patterns. Please use caution when driving through the area. Work zone safety is everyones responsibility.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Overhead Sign Inspections Continue Next Week in Allegheny County</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/overhead-sign-inspections-continue-next-week-allegheny-county__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 07 Feb 2019 19:59:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6049</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing overhead sign inspection activities in various locations in Allegheny County, will occur next week, Monday through Friday, February 11-15 weather permitting.

Lane restrictions will occur 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. each day in the following locations:

Monday, February 11
<ul>
 	<li>Highland Park Bridge (Route 1005) in each direction between Washington Avenue and Route 28</li>
</ul>
Tuesday, February 12
<ul>
 	<li>Boulevard of the Allies ramps at the Liberty Bridge interchange</li>
</ul>
Wednesday, February 13
<ul>
 	<li>40th Street Bridge (Route 2124) in each direction between Butler Street and Route 28</li>
 	<li>Clairton-Glassport Bridge (Route 2038) in each direction between Lincoln Boulevard and Route 837</li>
</ul>
Thursday, February 14
<ul>
 	<li>Route 28 in each direction between the 31st Street Bridge/Strip District (Exit 2) and the Etna (Exit 4) interchanges</li>
</ul>
Friday, February 15
<ul>
 	<li>Southbound I-279 at the East Street (Exit 4) off-ramp</li>
 	<li>I-279 High Occupancy Vehicle Lanes at Perrysville Avenue (Exit 5)</li>
 	<li>McKees Rocks Bridge (Route 3104) in each direction between Route 51 and Route 65</li>
</ul>
Crews from Mackin Engineering Company and the Sofis Rigging Company will conduct the inspections.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 885 Boulevard of the Allies Bridge Inspections Saturday and Sunday in Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-885-boulevard-allies-bridge-inspections-saturday-sunday-pittsburgh__trashed-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 08 Feb 2019 15:50:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6051</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing bridge inspection activities on the Boulevard of the Allies (Route 885) and westbound (inbound) I-376 (Parkway East) in the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, will continue on Saturday and Sunday, February 9-10 weather permitting.

Single-lane and shoulder restrictions will occur as needed on the Boulevard of the Allies, westbound I-376 (Parkway East) and associated ramps in the area of the Birmingham Bridge from 7 a.m. to noon each day.

Crews from JMT, WSP and the Sofis Rigging Company will conduct the inspection work.

Motorists should be prepared for changing traffic patterns. Please use caution when driving through the area. Work zone safety is everyones responsibility.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional Twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>East General Robinson Street Traffic Signal Improvements Next Week in Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/east-general-robinson-street-traffic-signal-improvements-next-week-pittsburgh__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 08 Feb 2019 21:17:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6061</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing traffic signal improvements on East General Robinson Street in the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, will begin Monday, February 11 weather permitting.

Traffic signal improvement work will occur from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. weekdays through Friday, February 15 at the intersection of East General Robinson Street and Anderson Street. Single-lane restrictions will occur as crews from the Trumbull Corporation conduct the work.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional Twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Route 2122 Butler Street Water Line Repairs begin Wednesday in Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-2122-butler-street-water-line-repairs-begin-wednesday-pittsburgh__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 11 Feb 2019 15:59:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6063</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing single-lane restrictions on Butler Street (Route 2122) in the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, will occur Wednesday through Friday, February 13-15 weather permitting.

Single-lane restrictions will occur as needed on Butler Street at the intersection with 46th Street from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. each day as crews from Poillucci Plumbing, Inc. conduct water line repairs.

PennDOT is not involved in this work and is providing this information as a public service announcement only. For additional information contact Nicholas Poillucci at 412-782-5050.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Route 837 West Carson Street Lane Closures this Week in Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-837-west-carson-street-lane-closures-week-pittsburgh__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 12 Feb 2019 17:37:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6065</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing lane closures on West Carson Street (Route 837) in the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, will occur Wednesday through Friday, February 13-15 weather permitting.

Single-lane closures will occur as needed on West Carson Street between the Wabash Tunnel and Commerce Drive from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. each day as crews from the Duquesne Light Company will conduct underground transformer removal.

PennDOT is not involved in this work and is providing this information as a public service announcement only. For additional information contact Traci Jackson at 412-393-7813.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 4021 Camp Horne Road Lane Restriction Thursday in Ohio Township  </title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-4021-camp-horne-road-lane-restriction-thursday-ohio-township-%e2%80%8b__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 12 Feb 2019 20:19:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6067</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing a lane restriction on Camp Horne Road (Route 4021) in Ohio Township, Allegheny County, will occur Thursday, February 14 weather permitting.

A single-lane restriction will occur as needed in the eastbound direction on Camp Horne Road between Ben Avon Heights Road and the on-ramp to southbound I-279 from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Thursday. Crews from Bronder Technical Services will conduct utility work.

The work is part of the $87.94 million I-279 Parkway North Improvement Project which includes concrete patching and overlay, preservation of 30 bridges and 49 overhead sign structures, repairs to 29 walls, ramp repairs, lighting improvements, HOV repairs, sign upgrades, guide rail and drainage improvements, and an anti-icing system installation on bridges at the McKnight Road interchange.

Please use caution while driving through the area. Work zone safety is everyones responsibility.

To help keep motorists informed as work progresses, PennDOT has created an email distribution list for I-279 Parkway North traffic advisories and construction updates. Enroll by sending email addresses to <a href="mailto:stcowan@pa.gov">stcowan@pa.gov</a>. Please write Subscribe  Parkway North in the subject line.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional Twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Inbound Squirrel Hill Tunnel Lane Restriction Wednesday Night in Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/inbound-squirrel-hill-tunnel-lane-restriction-wednesday-night-pittsburgh-2__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 12 Feb 2019 20:21:07 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6071</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT is announcing a lane restriction in the inbound (westbound) Squirrel Hill Tunnel (I-376 Parkway East) in the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, will occur Wednesday night, February 13.

A single-lane restriction will occur in the inbound direction of the tunnel from 10 p.m. Wednesday night to 5 a.m. Thursday morning as crews conduct hardware installation work.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Prospect Road in Baldwin Borough Closed Due to Landslide</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/prospect-road-baldwin-borough-closed-due-landslide__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 12 Feb 2019 20:47:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6073</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The Department of Public Works announced today that Prospect Road is closed between Beryl Drive and Streets Run Road in Baldwin Borough because of a landslide. One lane of the road is expected to reopen later this week after debris is cleared from the road and a barrier is installed.

Once one lane is reopened, traffic will be controlled with a signal where the road becomes a single lane.

There is currently no timetable for when the landslide area will be repaired and the road completely reopened.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Express E-ZPass Lanes Closing at Warrendale Toll Plaza Feb. 14</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/express-e-zpass-lanes-closing-warrendale-toll-plaza-feb-14__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 13 Feb 2019 20:41:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6095</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<em>Six-hour closure needed to clean tolling equipment.</em>

The Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission advises motorists that both eastbound and westbound Express E-ZPass lanes at the Warrendale Mainline Toll Plaza located at milepost #30 in Allegheny County will be closed from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. on Feb. 14. Only E-ZPass customers use these lanes, which allow travel at highway speeds.

E-ZPass customers can still pay electronically using the conventional E-ZPass lanes on the right side of the toll plaza. Motorists should be aware that the conventional E-ZPass lanes have a speed limit of 5 mph.

The six-hour closure is needed for crews to safely clean the salt residue from the tolling equipment that has built up from the recent snow events. This work will proceed as weather permits. Message boards will be in place to alert motorists of the lane closures.]]></content:encoded>
