	<item>
		<title>Northbound Fort Duquesne Bridge Overhead Sign Repairs Saturday in Pittsburgh</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/northbound-fort-duquesne-bridge-overhead-sign-repairs-saturday-pittsburgh__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 13 Feb 2019 20:42:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6097</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing overhead sign repair work on the Fort Duquesne Bridge (I-279) in the City of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, will occur Saturday, February 16 weather permitting.

A two-lane closure will occur as needed on the northbound (upper deck) Fort Duquesne Bridge from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Saturday for overhead sign repairs. Crews from the Trumbull Corporation will conduct the work.

Motorists should be prepared for changing traffic patterns. Please use caution when driving through the area. Work zone safety is everyones responsibility.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Highland Park Interchange Inspection Activities begin Monday in Allegheny County</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/highland-park-interchange-inspection-activities-begin-monday-allegheny-county__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 14 Feb 2019 14:57:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6100</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing inspection work at the Highland Park interchange in OHara Township and Sharpsburg and Aspinwall boroughs, Allegheny County, will begin Monday, February 18 weather permitting.

Inspection work will occur from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. according to the following schedule:

Monday, February 18
<ul>
 	<li>Single-lane alternating traffic on Lexington Avenue under Route 28</li>
 	<li>Single-lane alternating traffic on 23<sup>rd</sup> Street Extension under Route 28</li>
</ul>
Tuesday, February 19
<ul>
 	<li>Single-lane alternating traffic on Delafield Road under Route 28</li>
 	<li>Single-lane alternating traffic on Center Avenue under Route 28</li>
</ul>
Additional work will continue Wednesday, February 20. Details will be provided prior to work beginning.

&nbsp;

Crews from Michael Baker International, The Markosky Engineering Group, Inc. and the Pittsburgh Rigging Company will conduct inspection activities.

Motorists can check conditions on major roadways by visiting <a href="http://www.511PA.com">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional Twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Highland Park Interchange Inspection Activities begin Monday in Allegheny County</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/highland-park-interchange-inspection-activities-begin-monday-allegheny-county-2__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 15 Feb 2019 13:56:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6108</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing inspection work at the Highland Park interchange in OHara Township and Sharpsburg and Aspinwall boroughs, Allegheny County, will begin Monday, February 18 weather permitting.

Inspection work will occur from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. according to the following schedule:

Monday, February 18
<ul>
 	<li>Single-lane alternating traffic on Lexington Avenue under Route 28</li>
 	<li>Single-lane alternating traffic on 23rd Street Extension under Route 28</li>
</ul>
Tuesday, February 19
<ul>
 	<li>Single-lane alternating traffic on Delafield Road under Route 28</li>
 	<li>Single-lane alternating traffic on Center Avenue under Route 28</li>
</ul>
Additional work will continue Wednesday, February 20. Details will be provided prior to work beginning.

Crews from Michael Baker International, The Markosky Engineering Group, Inc. and the Pittsburgh Rigging Company will conduct inspection activities.

Motorists can check conditions on major roadways by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional Twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Route 837 State Street Gas Line Installation Tuesday and Wednesday in Clairton</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/route-837-state-street-gas-line-installation-tuesday-wednesday-clairton__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 15 Feb 2019 13:57:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6110</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[PennDOT District 11 is announcing gas line installation work on Route 837 (State Street) in the City of Clairton, Allegheny County, will occur Tuesday and Wednesday, February 19-20 weather permitting.

Single-lane restrictions will occur on State Street in each direction between Elm Street and Baily Way as crews from the Columbia Gas conduct gas line installation work. Restrictions will occur each day from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m.

PennDOT is not involved in this work and is providing this information as a public service announcement only. For additional information contact Dama Shoaf at 412-220-1524.

Motorists can check conditions on more than 40,000 roadway miles, including color-coded winter conditions on 2,900 miles, by visiting <a href="http://www.511pa.com/">www.511PA.com</a>. 511PA, which is free and available 24 hours a day, provides traffic delay warnings, weather forecasts, traffic speed information, and access to more than 860 traffic cameras.

511PA is also available through a smartphone application for iPhone and Android devices, by calling 5-1-1, or by following regional twitter alerts accessible on the 511PA website.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Overnight Closure Planned on PA Turnpike between Pittsburgh and Irwin Feb. 17</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/overnight-closure-planned-pa-turnpike-pittsburgh-irwin-feb-17__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 15 Feb 2019 19:21:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?p=6115</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<em>Five-hour closure needed for overhead bridge removal at milepost 59.6.</em>

The Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission advises motorists that the toll road will be closed overnight <strong>in </strong><strong>both directions between the Pittsburgh (Exit #57) and Irwin (Exit #67) interchanges </strong>on Feb. 17 from 12:01 a.m. to 5 a.m., weather permitting. The closure is needed to safely remove the original overhead bridge which carried traffic on Trafford-Murrysville Road over the Turnpike at milepost 59.6. The replacement bridge was opened to traffic in September 2018.

The recommended detour for eastbound traffic exiting at Pittsburgh Interchange is:

<strong>U.S. Route 22 east (10.5 miles) to Turnpike 66 south (7 miles) to U.S. Route 30 west (4.6 miles). Reenter the Turnpike at the Irwin Interchange and follow signs for Harrisburg and east.</strong>

The recommended detour for westbound traffic exiting at Irwin Interchange is:

<strong>U.S. Route 30 east (4.6 miles) to Turnpike 66 north (7 miles) to U.S. Route 22 west (10.5 miles). Reenter the Turnpike at the Pittsburgh Interchange and follow signs to Ohio and west.</strong>

Alternate-route cards with the detour directions will be available to travelers exiting at the Pittsburgh and Irwin interchanges. Expect higher traffic volumes on detour roads during the closure. Message boards will be in place to inform customers.

This early-action bridge work is a part of the future Total Reconstruction and Widening of the Turnpike between mileposts 57 and 67 anticipated to start in 2023. For more information on this project visit <u><a href="https://www.patpconstruction.com/mp57to67/">https://www.patpconstruction.com/mp57to67/</a></u> .

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Pitt Graduate Engineering Students Presentation</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/event/pitt-graduate-engineering-students-presentation/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 14 Mar 2017 19:51:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?post_type=tribe_events&#038;p=2823</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Come hear the results of a research project on a long range, multimodal plan for the Airport Corridor presented by Pitt graduate engineering students.

You'll have a chance to ask questions and give us your feedback. The cost to attend is $10.00. Desserts and drinks will be provided. Please RSVP by April 17th.

[gravityform id="16" title="true" description="true"]]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>ACT Emerging Mobility Summit</title>
		<link>https://actapgh.org/event/act-emerging-mobility-summit/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 15:16:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://actapgh.org/?post_type=tribe_events&#038;p=4329</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>Have a Say in the Future of Mobility</strong>

Early Bird registration ends March 16th!
<table width="100%">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td><a href="http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001QoKH8j2j53sqfizWdIg0O-Nvt-m_R7GtVA_ALlZwSMzQt2M0ph2OZC70lhcHsxFBFkJxyG0IexyGd5h7FLLCUgusbRjRmtzhBBn8c5tNfPxux46Af60dekrIIpWfCyOo-YXhmuI2HFGmZ3b9fgzPwY1AO22PQ9mK2C-B4ZKbiDo948vgr2myO09EPCP8ZafSY18XapjJpTE=&amp;c=IRW8scwIykASxQWq0x2w1_8Lvvf9P5YhG8l7vy3Oquzr5I4qQH01zg==&amp;ch=EeAYhACjCxpbq2jIoXXreYEaWauOEBNbHfuU4aHoEdhV2OmsemvU2w==">Emerging Mobility Summit, April 24-25, 2018 in Columbus, OH</a></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<table width="100%">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>ACT is bringing together thought leaders and practitionersfrom the public and private sectors, academia, and leading mobility providers for two days of conversations about the future of mobility and its integration with transportation demand management.

In addition to morning plenary sessions, day 1 will feature a unique offering of smalldiscussion groupsaimed at stimulating conversation for you and your peers to dive into selected topics; and work with our facilitatorsto find solutions to challenges and discuss forward-looking strategies for the future of mobility.

Discussion Groups include:
<ol>
 	<li>Government as a Mobility Accelerator-<strong>Mark De la Verne, City of Detroit</strong></li>
 	<li>Measuring the Evolving Mobility Landscapeto Influence Mode Choice -<strong>Ryan Croft, TransitScreen</strong></li>
 	<li>Creating Mobility Options in Low Density and Internet Challenged Communities-<strong>Valerie Lefler,Integrated Global Dimensions</strong></li>
 	<li>How to Grow Low-Car Living Through Partnerships with Car Sharing(Social Justice) -<strong>Sabrina Sussman, Zipcar</strong></li>
 	<li>Microtransit: Its impacts on transportation and why your community should care about it -<strong>Josh Cohen,TransLoc</strong></li>
 	<li>AV shuttles on business/university campusesDeveloping World-Class Employer Commute Programs in a Era of New Mobility Options -<strong>Sohier Hall, Luum</strong></li>
</ol>
To view the complete schedule and to register visit:<a href="http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001QoKH8j2j53sqfizWdIg0O-Nvt-m_R7GtVA_ALlZwSMzQt2M0ph2OZC70lhcHsxFBFkJxyG0IexyGd5h7FLLCUgusbRjRmtzhBBn8c5tNfPxux46Af60dekrIIpWfCyOo-YXhmuI2HFGmZ3b9fgzPwY1AO22PQ9mK2C-B4ZKbiDo948vgr2myO09EPCP8ZafSY18XapjJpTE=&amp;c=IRW8scwIykASxQWq0x2w1_8Lvvf9P5YhG8l7vy3Oquzr5I4qQH01zg==&amp;ch=EeAYhACjCxpbq2jIoXXreYEaWauOEBNbHfuU4aHoEdhV2OmsemvU2w=="><strong>Emerging Mobility Summit</strong></a></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>
